contents: For the man who was miraculously healed was over forty years old.

contents.verseText: On their release, Peter and John returned to their own people and reported everything that the chief priests and elders had said to them.
contents: On their release, Peter and John returned to their own people and reported everything that the chief priests and elders had said to them.

contents.verseText: When the believers heard this, they lifted up their voices to God with one accord. “Sovereign Lord,” they said, “You made the heaven and the earth and the sea and everything in them.
contents: When the believers heard this, they lifted up their voices to God with one accord. “Sovereign Lord,” they said, “You made the heaven and the earth and the sea and everything in them.

contents.verseText: You spoke by the Holy Spirit through the mouth of Your servant, our father David: ‘Why do the nations rage and the peoples plot in vain?
contents: You spoke by the Holy Spirit through the mouth of Your servant,

footnote.ft: Or child; also in verses 27 and 30

contents: our father David:
‘Why do the nations rage
and the peoples plot in vain?

contents.verseText: The kings of the earth take their stand and the rulers gather together against the Lord and against His Anointed One.’
contents: The kings of the earth take their stand
and the rulers gather together
against the Lord
and against His Anointed One.’

footnote.ft: Or His Christ or His Messiah; Psalm 2:1–2

contents.verseText: In fact, this is the very city where Herod and Pontius Pilate conspired with the Gentiles and the people of Israel against Your holy servant Jesus, whom You anointed.
contents: In fact, this is the very city where Herod and Pontius Pilate conspired with the Gentiles and the people of Israel against Your holy servant Jesus, whom You anointed.

contents.verseText: They carried out what Your hand and will had decided beforehand would happen.
contents: They carried out what Your hand and will had decided beforehand would happen.

contents.verseText: And now, Lord, consider their threats, and enable Your servants to speak Your word with complete boldness,
contents: And now, Lord, consider their threats, and enable Your servants to speak Your word with complete boldness,

contents.verseText: as You stretch out Your hand to heal and perform signs and wonders through the name of Your holy servant Jesus.”
contents: as You stretch out Your hand to heal and perform signs and wonders through the name of Your holy servant Jesus.”

contents.verseText: After they had prayed, their meeting place was shaken, and they were all filled with the Holy Spirit and spoke the word of God boldly.
contents: After they had prayed, their meeting place was shaken, and they were all filled with the Holy Spirit and spoke the word of God boldly.

contents.verseText: The multitude of believers was one in heart and soul. No one claimed that any of his possessions was his own, but they shared everything they owned.
contents: The multitude of believers was one in heart and soul. No one claimed that any of his possessions was his own, but they shared everything they owned.

contents.verseText: With great power the apostles continued to give their testimony about the resurrection of the Lord Jesus. And abundant grace was upon them all.
contents: With great power the apostles continued to give their testimony about the resurrection of the Lord Jesus. And abundant grace was upon them all.

contents.verseText: There were no needy ones among them, because those who owned lands or houses would sell their property, bring the proceeds from the sales,
contents: There were no needy ones among them, because those who owned lands or houses would sell their property, bring the proceeds from the sales,

contents.verseText: and lay them at the apostles’ feet for distribution to anyone as he had need.
contents: and lay them at the apostles’ feet for distribution to anyone as he had need.

contents.verseText: Joseph, a Levite from Cyprus, whom the apostles called Barnabas (meaning Son of Encouragement),
contents: Joseph, a Levite from Cyprus, whom the apostles called Barnabas (meaning Son of Encouragement),

contents.verseText: sold a field he owned, brought the money, and laid it at the apostles’ feet.
contents: sold a field he owned, brought the money, and laid it at the apostles’ feet.

contents.verseText: Now a man named Ananias, together with his wife Sapphira, also sold a piece of property.
contents: Now a man named Ananias, together with his wife Sapphira, also sold a piece of property.

contents.verseText: With his wife’s full knowledge, he kept back some of the proceeds for himself, but brought a portion and laid it at the apostles’ feet.
contents: With his wife’s full knowledge, he kept back some of the proceeds for himself, but brought a portion and laid it at the apostles’ feet.

contents.verseText: Then Peter said, “Ananias, how is it that Satan has filled your heart to lie to the Holy Spirit and withhold some of the proceeds from the land?
contents: Then Peter said, “Ananias, how is it that Satan has filled your heart to lie to the Holy Spirit and withhold some of the proceeds from the land?

contents.verseText: Did it not belong to you before it was sold? And after it was sold, was it not at your disposal? How could you conceive such a deed in your heart? You have not lied to men, but to God!”
contents: Did it not belong to you before it was sold? And after it was sold, was it not at your disposal? How could you conceive such a deed in your heart? You have not lied to men, but to God!”

contents.verseText: On hearing these words, Ananias fell down and died. And great fear came over all who heard what had happened.
contents: On hearing these words, Ananias fell down and died. And great fear came over all who heard what had happened.

contents.verseText: Then the young men stepped forward, wrapped up his body, and carried him out and buried him.
contents: Then the young men stepped forward, wrapped up his body, and carried him out and buried him.

contents.verseText: About three hours later his wife also came in, unaware of what had happened.
contents: About three hours later his wife also came in, unaware of what had happened.

contents.verseText: “Tell me,” said Peter, “is this the price you and your husband got for the land?” “Yes,” she answered, “that is the price.”
contents: “Tell me,” said Peter, “is this the price you and your husband got for the land?”
“Yes,” she answered, “that is the price.”

contents.verseText: “How could you agree to test the Spirit of the Lord?” Peter replied. “Look, the feet of the men who buried your husband are at the door, and they will carry you out also.”
contents: “How could you agree to test the Spirit of the Lord?” Peter replied. “Look, the feet of the men who buried your husband are at the door, and they will carry you out also.”

contents.verseText: At that instant she fell down at his feet and died. Then the young men came in and, finding her dead, carried her out and buried her beside her husband.
contents: At that instant she fell down at his feet and died. Then the young men came in and, finding her dead, carried her out and buried her beside her husband.

contents.verseText: And great fear came over the whole church and all who heard about these events.
contents: And great fear came over the whole church and all who heard about these events.

contents.verseText: The apostles performed many signs and wonders among the people, and with one accord the believers gathered together in Solomon’s Colonnade.
contents: The apostles performed many signs and wonders among the people, and with one accord the believers gathered together in Solomon’s Colonnade.

contents.verseText: Although the people regarded them highly, no one else dared to join them.
contents: Although the people regarded them highly, no one else dared to join them.

contents.verseText: Yet more and more believers were brought to the Lord—large numbers of both men and women.
contents: Yet more and more believers were brought to the Lord—large numbers of both men and women.

contents.verseText: As a result, people brought the sick into the streets and laid them on cots and mats, so that at least Peter’s shadow might fall on some of them as he passed by.
contents: As a result, people brought the sick into the streets and laid them on cots and mats, so that at least Peter’s shadow might fall on some of them as he passed by.

contents.verseText: Crowds also gathered from the towns around Jerusalem, bringing the sick and those tormented by unclean spirits, and all of them were healed.
contents: Crowds also gathered from the towns around Jerusalem, bringing the sick and those tormented by unclean spirits, and all of them were healed.

contents.verseText: Then the high priest and all his associates, who belonged to the party of the Sadducees, were filled with jealousy. They went out
contents: Then the high priest and all his associates, who belonged to the party of the Sadducees, were filled with jealousy. They went out

contents.verseText: and arrested the apostles and put them in the public jail.
contents: and arrested the apostles and put them in the public jail.

contents.verseText: But during the night an angel of the Lord opened the doors of the jail and brought them out, saying,
contents: But during the night an angel of the Lord opened the doors of the jail and brought them out, saying,

contents.verseText: “Go, stand in the temple courts and tell the people the full message of this new life.”
contents: “Go, stand in the temple courts

footnote.ft: Literally the temple; also in verses 21, 25, and 42

contents: and tell the people the full message of this new life.”

contents.verseText: At daybreak the apostles entered the temple courts as they had been told and began to teach the people. When the high priest and his associates arrived, they convened the Sanhedrin—the full assembly of the elders of Israel—and sent to the jail for the apostles.
contents: At daybreak the apostles entered the temple courts as they had been told and began to teach the people.
When the high priest and his associates arrived, they convened the Sanhedrin

footnote.ft: Or the Council; also in verses 27, 34, and 41

contents: —the full assembly of the elders of Israel—and sent to the jail for the apostles.

contents.verseText: But on arriving at the jail, the officers did not find them there. So they returned with the report:
contents: But on arriving at the jail, the officers did not find them there. So they returned with the report:

contents.verseText: “We found the jail securely locked, with the guards posted at the doors; but when we opened them, we found no one inside.”
contents: “We found the jail securely locked, with the guards posted at the doors; but when we opened them, we found no one inside.”

contents.verseText: When the captain of the temple guard and the chief priests heard this account, they were perplexed as to what was happening.
contents: When the captain of the temple guard and the chief priests heard this account, they were perplexed as to what was happening.

footnote.ft: Literally as to what this might be

contents.verseText: Then someone came in and announced, “Look, the men you put in jail are standing in the temple courts teaching the people!”
contents: Then someone came in and announced, “Look, the men you put in jail are standing in the temple courts teaching the people!”

contents.verseText: At that point, the captain went with the officers and brought the apostles—but not by force, for fear the people would stone them.
contents: At that point, the captain went with the officers and brought the apostles—but not by force, for fear the people would stone them.

contents.verseText: They brought them in and made them stand before the Sanhedrin, where the high priest interrogated them.
contents: They brought them in and made them stand before the Sanhedrin, where the high priest interrogated them.

contents.verseText: “We gave you strict orders not to teach in this name,” he said. “Yet you have filled Jerusalem with your teaching and are determined to make us responsible for this man’s blood.”
contents: “We gave you strict orders not to teach in this name,” he said. “Yet you have filled Jerusalem with your teaching and are determined to make us responsible for this man’s blood.”

contents.verseText: But Peter and the other apostles replied, “We must obey God rather than men.
contents: But Peter and the other apostles replied, “We must obey God rather than men.

contents.verseText: The God of our fathers raised up Jesus, whom you had killed by hanging Him on a tree.
contents: The God of our fathers raised up Jesus, whom you had killed by hanging Him on a tree.

contents.verseText: God exalted Him to His right hand as Prince and Savior, in order to grant repentance and forgiveness of sins to Israel.
contents: God exalted Him to His right hand as Prince and Savior, in order to grant repentance and forgiveness of sins to Israel.

contents.verseText: We are witnesses of these things, and so is the Holy Spirit, whom God has given to those who obey Him.”
contents: We are witnesses of these things, and so is the Holy Spirit, whom God has given to those who obey Him.”

contents.verseText: When the Council members heard this, they were enraged, and they resolved to put the apostles to death.
contents: When the Council members heard this, they were enraged, and they resolved

footnote.ft: ECM, BYZ, TR, and Tischendorf; or they took counsel; NA, SBL, NE, and WH they wanted

contents: to put the apostles to death.

contents.verseText: But a Pharisee named Gamaliel, a teacher of the law who was honored by all the people, stood up in the Sanhedrin and ordered that the men be put outside for a short time.
contents: But a Pharisee named Gamaliel, a teacher of the law who was honored by all the people, stood up in the Sanhedrin and ordered that the men be put outside for a short time.

contents.verseText: “Men of Israel,” he said, “consider carefully what you are about to do to these men.
contents: “Men of Israel,” he said, “consider carefully what you are about to do to these men.

contents.verseText: Some time ago Theudas rose up, claiming to be somebody, and about four hundred men joined him. He was killed, all his followers were dispersed, and it all came to nothing.
contents: Some time ago Theudas rose up, claiming to be somebody, and about four hundred men joined him. He was killed, all his followers were dispersed, and it all came to nothing.

contents.verseText: After him, Judas the Galilean appeared in the days of the census and drew away people after him. He too perished, and all his followers were scattered.
contents: After him, Judas the Galilean appeared in the days of the census and drew away people after him. He too perished, and all his followers were scattered.

contents.verseText: So in the present case I advise you: Leave these men alone. Let them go! For if their purpose or endeavor is of human origin, it will fail.
contents: So in the present case I advise you: Leave these men alone. Let them go! For if their purpose or endeavor is of human origin, it will fail.

contents.verseText: But if it is from God, you will not be able to stop them. You may even find yourselves fighting against God.”
contents: But if it is from God, you will not be able to stop them. You may even find yourselves fighting against God.”

contents.verseText: At this, they yielded to Gamaliel. They called the apostles in and had them flogged. Then they ordered them not to speak in the name of Jesus, and released them.
contents: At this, they yielded to Gamaliel. They called the apostles in and had them flogged. Then they ordered them not to speak in the name of Jesus, and released them.

contents.verseText: The apostles left the Sanhedrin, rejoicing that they had been counted worthy of suffering disgrace for the Name.
contents: The apostles left the Sanhedrin, rejoicing that they had been counted worthy of suffering disgrace for the Name.

contents.verseText: Every day, in the temple courts and from house to house, they did not stop teaching and proclaiming the good news that Jesus is the Christ.
contents: Every day, in the temple courts and from house to house, they did not stop teaching and proclaiming the good news that Jesus is the Christ.

contents.verseText: In those days when the disciples were increasing in number, the Grecian Jews among them began to grumble against the Hebraic Jews because their widows were being overlooked in the daily distribution of food.
contents: In those days when the disciples were increasing in number, the Grecian Jews among them began to grumble against the Hebraic Jews

footnote.ft: Literally the Hellenists began to grumble against the Hebrews

contents: because their widows were being overlooked in the daily distribution of food.

contents.verseText: So the Twelve summoned all the disciples and said, “It is unacceptable for us to neglect the word of God in order to wait on tables.
contents: So the Twelve summoned all the disciples and said, “It is unacceptable for us to neglect the word of God in order to wait on tables.

contents.verseText: Therefore, brothers, select from among you seven men confirmed to be full of the Spirit and wisdom. We will appoint this responsibility to them
contents: Therefore, brothers, select from among you seven men confirmed to be full of the Spirit and wisdom. We will appoint this responsibility to them

contents.verseText: and will devote ourselves to prayer and to the ministry of the word.”
contents: and will devote ourselves to prayer and to the ministry of the word.”

contents.verseText: This proposal pleased the whole group. They chose Stephen, a man full of faith and of the Holy Spirit, as well as Philip, Prochorus, Nicanor, Timon, Parmenas, and Nicolas from Antioch, a convert to Judaism.
contents: This proposal pleased the whole group. They chose Stephen, a man full of faith and of the Holy Spirit, as well as Philip, Prochorus, Nicanor, Timon, Parmenas, and Nicolas from Antioch, a convert to Judaism.

footnote.ft: Literally and Nicolas, a convert of Antioch,

contents.verseText: They presented these seven to the apostles, who prayed and laid their hands on them.
contents: They presented these seven to the apostles,

footnote.ft: Literally—whom they set before the apostles,

contents: who prayed and laid their hands on them.

contents.verseText: So the word of God continued to spread. The number of disciples in Jerusalem grew rapidly, and a great number of priests became obedient to the faith.
contents: So the word of God continued to spread. The number of disciples in Jerusalem grew rapidly, and a great number of priests became obedient to the faith.

contents.verseText: Now Stephen, who was full of grace and power, was performing great wonders and signs among the people.
contents: Now Stephen, who was full of grace and power, was performing great wonders and signs among the people.

contents.verseText: But resistance arose from what was called the Synagogue of the Freedmen, including Cyrenians, Alexandrians, and men from the provinces of Cilicia and Asia. They began to argue with Stephen,
contents: But resistance arose from what was called the Synagogue of the Freedmen, including Cyrenians, Alexandrians, and men from the provinces of Cilicia and Asia.

footnote.ft: Literally and those from Cilicia and Asia; the Roman Province of Asia was located in what is now western Turkey.

contents: They began to argue with Stephen,

contents.verseText: but they could not stand up to his wisdom or the Spirit by whom he spoke.
contents: but they could not stand up to his wisdom or the Spirit by whom he spoke.

contents.verseText: Then they prompted some men to say, “We heard Stephen speak words of blasphemy against Moses and against God.”
contents: Then they prompted some men to say, “We heard Stephen speak words of blasphemy against Moses and against God.”

contents.verseText: So they stirred up the people, elders, and scribes and confronted Stephen. They seized him and brought him before the Sanhedrin,
contents: So they stirred up the people, elders, and scribes and confronted Stephen. They seized him and brought him before the Sanhedrin,

footnote.ft: Or the Council; also in verse 15

contents.verseText: where they presented false witnesses who said, “This man never stops speaking against this holy place and against the law.
contents: where they presented false witnesses who said, “This man never stops speaking against this holy place and against the law.

contents.verseText: For we have heard him say that Jesus of Nazareth will destroy this place and change the customs that Moses handed down to us.”
contents: For we have heard him say that Jesus of Nazareth will destroy this place and change the customs that Moses handed down to us.”

contents.verseText: All who were sitting in the Sanhedrin looked intently at Stephen, and they saw that his face was like the face of an angel.
contents: All who were sitting in the Sanhedrin looked intently at Stephen, and they saw that his face was like the face of an angel.

s1: Stephen’s Address: The Call of Abraham

contents.verseText: Then the high priest asked Stephen, “Are these charges true?”
contents: Then the high priest asked Stephen, “Are these charges true?”

contents.verseText: And Stephen declared: “Brothers and fathers, listen to me! The God of glory appeared to our father Abraham while he was still in Mesopotamia, before he lived in Haran,
contents: And Stephen declared: “Brothers and fathers, listen to me! The God of glory appeared to our father Abraham while he was still in Mesopotamia, before he lived in Haran,

contents.verseText: and told him, ‘Leave your country and your kindred and go to the land I will show you.’
contents: and told him, ‘Leave your country and your kindred and go to the land I will show you.’

footnote.ft: Genesis 12:1

contents.verseText: So Abraham left the land of the Chaldeans and settled in Haran. After his father died, God brought him out of that place and into this land where you are now living.
contents: So Abraham left the land of the Chaldeans and settled in Haran. After his father died, God brought him out of that place and into this land where you are now living.

contents.verseText: He gave him no inheritance here, not even a foot of ground. But God promised to give possession of the land to Abraham and his descendants, even though he did not yet have a child.
contents: He gave him no inheritance here, not even a foot of ground. But God promised to give possession of the land to Abraham and his descendants, even though he did not yet have a child.

contents.verseText: God told him that his descendants would be foreigners in a strange land, and that they would be enslaved and mistreated four hundred years.
contents: God told him that his descendants would be foreigners in a strange land, and that they would be enslaved and mistreated four hundred years.

contents.verseText: ‘But I will punish the nation that enslaves them,’ God said, ‘and afterward they will come forth and worship Me in this place.’
contents: ‘But I will punish the nation that enslaves them,’ God said, ‘and afterward they will come forth and worship Me in this place.’

footnote.ft: Genesis 15:13–14; Exodus 3:12

contents.verseText: Then God gave Abraham the covenant of circumcision, and Abraham became the father of Isaac and circumcised him on the eighth day. And Isaac became the father of Jacob, and Jacob of the twelve patriarchs.
contents: Then God gave Abraham the covenant of circumcision, and Abraham became the father of Isaac and circumcised him on the eighth day. And Isaac became the father of Jacob, and Jacob of the twelve patriarchs.

contents.verseText: Because the patriarchs were jealous of Joseph, they sold him as a slave into Egypt. But God was with him
contents: Because the patriarchs were jealous of Joseph, they sold him as a slave into Egypt. But God was with him

contents.verseText: and rescued him from all his troubles. He granted Joseph favor and wisdom in the sight of Pharaoh king of Egypt, who appointed him ruler over Egypt and all his household.
contents: and rescued him from all his troubles. He granted Joseph favor and wisdom in the sight of Pharaoh king of Egypt, who appointed him ruler over Egypt and all his household.

contents.verseText: Then famine and great suffering swept across Egypt and Canaan, and our fathers could not find food.
contents: Then famine and great suffering swept across Egypt and Canaan, and our fathers could not find food.

contents.verseText: When Jacob heard that there was grain in Egypt, he sent our fathers on their first visit.
contents: When Jacob heard that there was grain in Egypt, he sent our fathers on their first visit.

contents.verseText: On their second visit, Joseph revealed his identity to his brothers, and his family became known to Pharaoh.
contents: On their second visit, Joseph revealed his identity to

footnote.ft: Or Joseph was made known to or Joseph was recognized by

contents: his brothers, and his family became known to Pharaoh.

contents.verseText: Then Joseph sent for his father Jacob and all his relatives, seventy-five in all.
contents: Then Joseph sent for his father Jacob and all his relatives, seventy-five in all.

contents.verseText: So Jacob went down to Egypt, where he and our fathers died.
contents: So Jacob went down to Egypt, where he and our fathers died.

contents.verseText: Their bones were carried back to Shechem and placed in the tomb that Abraham had bought from the sons of Hamor at Shechem for a price he paid in silver.
contents: Their bones were carried back

footnote.ft: Literally And they were carried back

contents: to Shechem and placed in the tomb that Abraham had bought from the sons of Hamor at Shechem for a price he paid in silver.

contents.verseText: As the time drew near for God to fulfill His promise to Abraham, our people in Egypt increased greatly in number.
contents: As the time drew near for God to fulfill His promise to Abraham, our people in Egypt increased greatly in number.

contents.verseText: Then another king, who knew nothing of Joseph, arose over Egypt.
contents: Then another king, who knew nothing of Joseph, arose over Egypt.

contents.verseText: He exploited our people and oppressed our fathers, forcing them to abandon their infants so they would die.
contents: He exploited our people and oppressed our fathers, forcing them to abandon their infants so they would die.

s1: The Birth and Adoption of Moses

contents.verseText: At that time Moses was born, and he was beautiful in the sight of God. For three months he was nurtured in his father’s house.
contents: At that time Moses was born, and he was beautiful in the sight of God.

footnote.ft: Or he was of great status in God’s eyes or he was no ordinary child

contents: For three months he was nurtured in his father’s house.

contents.verseText: When he was set outside, Pharaoh’s daughter took him and brought him up as her own son.
contents: When he was set outside, Pharaoh’s daughter took him and brought him up as her own son.

contents.verseText: So Moses was educated in all the wisdom of the Egyptians and was powerful in speech and action.
contents: So Moses was educated in all the wisdom of the Egyptians and was powerful in speech and action.

s1: The Rejection and Flight of Moses

contents.verseText: When Moses was forty years old, he decided to visit his brothers, the children of Israel.
contents: When Moses was forty years old, he decided to visit his brothers, the children of Israel.

contents.verseText: And when he saw one of them being mistreated, Moses went to his defense and avenged him by striking down the Egyptian who was oppressing him.
contents: And when he saw one of them being mistreated, Moses went to his defense and avenged him by striking down the Egyptian who was oppressing him.

contents.verseText: He assumed his brothers would understand that God was using him to deliver them, but they did not.
contents: He assumed his brothers would understand that God was using him to deliver them, but they did not.

contents.verseText: The next day he came upon two Israelites who were fighting, and he tried to reconcile them, saying, ‘Men, you are brothers. Why are you mistreating each other?’
contents: The next day he came upon two Israelites who were fighting, and he tried to reconcile them, saying, ‘Men, you are brothers. Why are you mistreating each other?’

contents.verseText: But the man who was abusing his neighbor pushed Moses aside and said, ‘Who made you ruler and judge over us?
contents: But the man who was abusing his neighbor pushed Moses aside and said, ‘Who made you ruler and judge over us?

contents.verseText: Do you want to kill me as you killed the Egyptian yesterday?’
contents: Do you want to kill me as you killed the Egyptian yesterday?’

footnote.ft: Exodus 2:13–14 (see also LXX)

contents.verseText: At this remark, Moses fled to the land of Midian, where he lived as a foreigner and had two sons.
contents: At this remark, Moses fled to the land of Midian, where he lived as a foreigner and had two sons.

contents.verseText: After forty years had passed, an angel appeared to Moses in the flames of a burning bush in the desert near Mount Sinai.
contents: After forty years had passed, an angel appeared to Moses in the flames of a burning bush in the desert near Mount Sinai.

contents.verseText: When Moses saw it, he marveled at the sight. As he approached to look more closely, the voice of the Lord came to him:
contents: When Moses saw it, he marveled at the sight. As he approached to look more closely, the voice of the Lord came to him:

contents.verseText: ‘I am the God of your fathers, the God of Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob.’ Moses trembled with fear and did not dare to look.
contents: ‘I am the God of your fathers, the God of Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob.’

footnote.ft: Exodus 3:6

contents: Moses trembled with fear and did not dare to look.

contents.verseText: Then the Lord said to him, ‘Take off your sandals, for the place where you are standing is holy ground.
contents: Then the Lord said to him, ‘Take off your sandals, for the place where you are standing is holy ground.

contents.verseText: I have indeed seen the oppression of My people in Egypt. I have heard their groaning and have come down to deliver them. Now come, I will send you back to Egypt.’
contents: I have indeed seen the oppression of My people in Egypt. I have heard their groaning and have come down to deliver them. Now come, I will send you back to Egypt.’

footnote.ft: Exodus 3:5–10

contents.verseText: This Moses, whom they had rejected with the words, ‘Who made you ruler and judge?’ is the one whom God sent to be their ruler and redeemer through the angel who appeared to him in the bush.
contents: This Moses, whom they had rejected with the words, ‘Who made you ruler and judge?’

footnote.ft: Exodus 2:14

contents: is the one whom God sent to be their ruler and redeemer through the angel

footnote.ft: Or Angel; also in verse 38

contents: who appeared to him in the bush.

contents.verseText: He led them out and performed wonders and signs in the land of Egypt, at the Red Sea, and for forty years in the wilderness.
contents: He led them out and performed wonders and signs in the land of Egypt, at the Red Sea, and for forty years in the wilderness.

contents.verseText: This is the same Moses who told the Israelites, ‘God will raise up for you a prophet like me from among your brothers.’
contents: This is the same Moses who told the Israelites, ‘God will raise up for you a prophet like me from among your brothers.’

footnote.ft: Deuteronomy 18:15

contents.verseText: He was in the assembly in the wilderness with the angel who spoke to him on Mount Sinai, and with our fathers. And he received living words to pass on to us.
contents: He was in the assembly in the wilderness with the angel who spoke to him on Mount Sinai, and with our fathers. And he received living words to pass on to us.
