contents.verseText: But our fathers refused to obey him. Instead, they rejected him and in their hearts turned back to Egypt.
contents: But our fathers refused to obey him. Instead, they rejected him and in their hearts turned back to Egypt.

contents.verseText: They said to Aaron, ‘Make us gods who will go before us! As for this Moses who led us out of the land of Egypt, we do not know what has happened to him.’
contents: They said to Aaron, ‘Make us gods who will go before us! As for this Moses who led us out of the land of Egypt, we do not know what has happened to him.’

footnote.ft: Exodus 32:1

contents.verseText: At that time they made a calf and offered a sacrifice to the idol, rejoicing in the works of their hands.
contents: At that time they made a calf and offered a sacrifice to the idol, rejoicing in the works of their hands.

contents.verseText: But God turned away from them and gave them over to the worship of the host of heaven, as it is written in the book of the prophets: ‘Did you bring Me sacrifices and offerings forty years in the wilderness, O house of Israel?
contents: But God turned away from them and gave them over to the worship of the host of heaven, as it is written in the book of the prophets:
‘Did you bring Me sacrifices and offerings
forty years in the wilderness, O house of Israel?

contents.verseText: You have taken along the tabernacle of Molech and the star of your god Rephan, the idols you made to worship. Therefore I will send you into exile beyond Babylon.’
contents: You have taken along the tabernacle of Molech
and the star of your god Rephan,
the idols you made to worship.
Therefore I will send you into exile
beyond Babylon.’

footnote.ft: Amos 5:25–27 (see also LXX)

contents.verseText: Our fathers had the tabernacle of the Testimony with them in the wilderness. It was constructed exactly as God had directed Moses, according to the pattern he had seen.
contents: Our fathers had the tabernacle of the Testimony with them in the wilderness. It was constructed exactly as God had directed Moses, according to the pattern he had seen.

contents.verseText: And our fathers who received it brought it in with Joshua when they dispossessed the nations God drove out before them. It remained until the time of David,
contents: And our fathers who received it brought it in with Joshua when they dispossessed the nations God drove out before them. It remained until the time of David,

contents.verseText: who found favor in the sight of God and asked to provide a dwelling place for the God of Jacob.
contents: who found favor in the sight of God and asked to provide a dwelling place for the God of Jacob.

footnote.ft: SBL, WH, BYZ, and TR; see also LXX for Psalm 132:5; ECM, NA, and NE a dwelling place for the house of Jacob.

contents.verseText: But it was Solomon who built the house for Him.
contents: But it was Solomon who built the house for Him.

contents.verseText: However, the Most High does not dwell in houses made by human hands. As the prophet says:
contents: However, the Most High does not dwell in houses made by human hands. As the prophet says:

contents.verseText: ‘Heaven is My throne and the earth is My footstool. What kind of house will you build for Me, says the Lord, or where will My place of repose be?
contents: ‘Heaven is My throne
and the earth is My footstool.
What kind of house will you build for Me, says the Lord,
or where will My place of repose be?

contents.verseText: Has not My hand made all these things?’
contents: Has not My hand made all these things?’

footnote.ft: Isaiah 66:1–2

contents.verseText: You stiff-necked people with uncircumcised hearts and ears! You always resist the Holy Spirit, just as your fathers did.
contents: You stiff-necked people with uncircumcised hearts and ears! You always resist the Holy Spirit, just as your fathers did.

contents.verseText: Which of the prophets did your fathers fail to persecute? They even killed those who foretold the coming of the Righteous One. And now you are His betrayers and murderers—
contents: Which of the prophets did your fathers fail to persecute? They even killed those who foretold the coming of the Righteous One. And now you are His betrayers and murderers—

contents.verseText: you who received the law ordained by angels, yet have not kept it.”
contents: you who received the law ordained by angels, yet have not kept it.”

contents.verseText: On hearing this, the members of the Sanhedrin were enraged, and they gnashed their teeth at him.
contents: On hearing this, the members of the Sanhedrin were enraged,

footnote.ft: Literally On hearing these things, they were cut in their hearts,

contents: and they gnashed their teeth at him.

contents.verseText: But Stephen, full of the Holy Spirit, looked intently into heaven and saw the glory of God and Jesus standing at the right hand of God.
contents: But Stephen, full of the Holy Spirit, looked intently into heaven and saw the glory of God and Jesus standing at the right hand of God.

contents.verseText: “Look,” he said, “I see heaven open and the Son of Man standing at the right hand of God.”
contents: “Look,” he said, “I see heaven open and the Son of Man standing at the right hand of God.”

contents.verseText: At this they covered their ears, cried out in a loud voice, and rushed together at him.
contents: At this they covered their ears, cried out in a loud voice, and rushed together at him.

contents.verseText: They dragged him out of the city and began to stone him. Meanwhile the witnesses laid their garments at the feet of a young man named Saul.
contents: They dragged him out of the city and began to stone him. Meanwhile the witnesses laid their garments at the feet of a young man named Saul.

contents.verseText: While they were stoning him, Stephen appealed, “Lord Jesus, receive my spirit.”
contents: While they were stoning him, Stephen appealed, “Lord Jesus, receive my spirit.”

contents.verseText: Falling on his knees, he cried out in a loud voice, “Lord, do not hold this sin against them.” And when he had said this, he fell asleep.
contents: Falling on his knees, he cried out in a loud voice, “Lord, do not hold this sin against them.” And when he had said this, he fell asleep.

contents.verseText: And Saul was there, giving approval to Stephen’s death. On that day a great persecution broke out against the church in Jerusalem, and all except the apostles were scattered throughout Judea and Samaria.
contents: And Saul was there, giving approval to Stephen’s death.
On that day a great persecution broke out against the church in Jerusalem, and all except the apostles were scattered throughout Judea and Samaria.

contents.verseText: God-fearing men buried Stephen and mourned deeply over him.
contents: God-fearing men buried Stephen and mourned deeply over him.

contents.verseText: But Saul began to destroy the church. Going from house to house, he dragged off men and women and put them in prison.
contents: But Saul began to destroy the church. Going from house to house, he dragged off men and women and put them in prison.

contents.verseText: Those who had been scattered preached the word wherever they went.
contents: Those who had been scattered preached the word wherever they went.

contents.verseText: Philip went down to a city in Samaria and proclaimed the Christ to them.
contents: Philip went down to a city in Samaria and proclaimed the Christ to them.

contents.verseText: The crowds gave their undivided attention to Philip’s message and to the signs they saw him perform.
contents: The crowds gave their undivided attention to Philip’s message and to the signs they saw him perform.

contents.verseText: With loud shrieks, unclean spirits came out of many who were possessed, and many of the paralyzed and lame were healed.
contents: With loud shrieks, unclean spirits came out of many who were possessed, and many of the paralyzed and lame were healed.

contents.verseText: So there was great joy in that city.
contents: So there was great joy in that city.

contents.verseText: Prior to that time, a man named Simon had practiced sorcery in the city and astounded the people of Samaria. He claimed to be someone great,
contents: Prior to that time, a man named Simon had practiced sorcery in the city and astounded the people of Samaria. He claimed to be someone great,

contents.verseText: and all the people, from the least to the greatest, heeded his words and said, “This man is the divine power called the Great Power.”
contents: and all the people, from the least to the greatest, heeded his words and said, “This man is the divine power called the Great Power.”

contents.verseText: They paid close attention to him because he had astounded them for a long time with his sorcery.
contents: They paid close attention to him because he had astounded them for a long time with his sorcery.

contents.verseText: But when they believed Philip as he preached the gospel of the kingdom of God and the name of Jesus Christ, they were baptized, both men and women.
contents: But when they believed Philip as he preached the gospel of the kingdom of God and the name of Jesus Christ, they were baptized, both men and women.

contents.verseText: Even Simon himself believed and was baptized. He followed Philip closely and was astounded by the great signs and miracles he observed.
contents: Even Simon himself believed and was baptized. He followed Philip closely and was astounded by the great signs and miracles he observed.

contents.verseText: When the apostles in Jerusalem heard that Samaria had received the word of God, they sent Peter and John to them.
contents: When the apostles in Jerusalem heard that Samaria had received the word of God, they sent Peter and John to them.

contents.verseText: On their arrival, they prayed for them to receive the Holy Spirit.
contents: On their arrival, they prayed for them to receive the Holy Spirit.

contents.verseText: For the Holy Spirit had not yet fallen upon any of them; they had simply been baptized into the name of the Lord Jesus.
contents: For the Holy Spirit had not yet fallen upon any of them; they had simply been baptized into the name of the Lord Jesus.

contents.verseText: Then Peter and John laid their hands on them, and they received the Holy Spirit.
contents: Then Peter and John laid their hands on them, and they received the Holy Spirit.

contents.verseText: When Simon saw that the Spirit was given through the laying on of the apostles’ hands, he offered them money.
contents: When Simon saw that the Spirit was given through the laying on of the apostles’ hands, he offered them money.

contents.verseText: “Give me this power as well,” he said, “so that everyone on whom I lay my hands may receive the Holy Spirit.”
contents: “Give me this power as well,” he said, “so that everyone on whom I lay my hands may receive the Holy Spirit.”

contents.verseText: But Peter replied, “May your silver perish with you, because you thought you could buy the gift of God with money!
contents: But Peter replied, “May your silver perish with you, because you thought you could buy the gift of God with money!

contents.verseText: You have no part or share in our ministry, because your heart is not right before God.
contents: You have no part or share in our ministry, because your heart is not right before God.

contents.verseText: Repent, therefore, of your wickedness, and pray to the Lord. Perhaps He will forgive you for the intent of your heart.
contents: Repent, therefore, of your wickedness, and pray to the Lord. Perhaps He will forgive you for the intent of your heart.

contents.verseText: For I see that you are poisoned by bitterness and captive to iniquity.”
contents: For I see that you are poisoned by bitterness and captive to iniquity.”

contents.verseText: Then Simon answered, “Pray to the Lord for me, so that nothing you have said may happen to me.”
contents: Then Simon answered, “Pray to the Lord for me, so that nothing you have said may happen to me.”

contents.verseText: And after Peter and John had testified and spoken the word of the Lord, they returned to Jerusalem, preaching the gospel in many of the Samaritan villages.
contents: And after Peter and John had testified and spoken the word of the Lord, they returned to Jerusalem, preaching the gospel in many of the Samaritan villages.

contents.verseText: Now an angel of the Lord said to Philip, “Get up and go south to the desert road that goes down from Jerusalem to Gaza.”
contents: Now an angel of the Lord said to Philip, “Get up and go south to the desert road that goes down from Jerusalem to Gaza.”

contents.verseText: So he started out, and on his way he met an Ethiopian eunuch, a court official in charge of the entire treasury of Candace, queen of the Ethiopians. He had gone to Jerusalem to worship,
contents: So he started out, and on his way he met an Ethiopian eunuch, a court official in charge of the entire treasury of Candace,

footnote.ft: Greek Kandakē

contents: queen of the Ethiopians. He had gone to Jerusalem to worship,

contents.verseText: and on his return was sitting in his chariot reading Isaiah the prophet.
contents: and on his return was sitting in his chariot reading Isaiah the prophet.

contents.verseText: The Spirit said to Philip, “Go over to that chariot and stay by it.”
contents: The Spirit said to Philip, “Go over to that chariot and stay by it.”

contents.verseText: So Philip ran up and heard the man reading Isaiah the prophet. “Do you understand what you are reading?” Philip asked.
contents: So Philip ran up and heard the man reading Isaiah the prophet. “Do you understand what you are reading?” Philip asked.

contents.verseText: “How can I,” he said, “unless someone guides me?” And he invited Philip to come up and sit with him.
contents: “How can I,” he said, “unless someone guides me?” And he invited Philip to come up and sit with him.

contents.verseText: The eunuch was reading this passage of Scripture: “He was led like a sheep to the slaughter, and as a lamb before the shearer is silent, so He did not open His mouth.
contents: The eunuch was reading this passage of Scripture:
“He was led like a sheep to the slaughter,
and as a lamb before the shearer is silent,
so He did not open His mouth.

contents.verseText: In His humiliation He was deprived of justice. Who can recount His descendants? For His life was removed from the earth.”
contents: In His humiliation He was deprived of justice.
Who can recount His descendants?
For His life was removed from the earth.”

footnote.ft: Isaiah 53:7–8 (see also LXX)

contents.verseText: “Tell me,” said the eunuch, “who is the prophet talking about, himself or someone else?”
contents: “Tell me,” said the eunuch, “who is the prophet talking about, himself or someone else?”

contents.verseText: Then Philip began with this very Scripture and told him the good news about Jesus.
contents: Then Philip began with this very Scripture and told him the good news about Jesus.

contents.verseText: As they traveled along the road and came to some water, the eunuch said, “Look, here is water! What is there to prevent me from being baptized?”
contents: As they traveled along the road and came to some water, the eunuch said, “Look, here is water! What is there to prevent me from being baptized?”

footnote.ft: TR includes 37 And Philip said, “If you believe with all your heart, you may be baptized.” The eunuch replied, “I believe that Jesus Christ is the Son of God.”

contents.verseText: And he gave orders to stop the chariot. Then both Philip and the eunuch went down into the water, and Philip baptized him.
contents: And he gave orders to stop the chariot. Then both Philip and the eunuch went down into the water, and Philip baptized him.

contents.verseText: When they came up out of the water, the Spirit of the Lord carried Philip away, and the eunuch saw him no more, but went on his way rejoicing.
contents: When they came up out of the water, the Spirit of the Lord carried Philip away, and the eunuch saw him no more, but went on his way rejoicing.

contents.verseText: But Philip appeared at Azotus and traveled through that region, preaching the gospel in all the towns until he came to Caesarea.
contents: But Philip appeared at Azotus and traveled through that region, preaching the gospel in all the towns until he came to Caesarea.

contents.verseText: Meanwhile, Saul was still breathing out murderous threats against the disciples of the Lord. He approached the high priest
contents: Meanwhile, Saul was still breathing out murderous threats against the disciples of the Lord. He approached the high priest

contents.verseText: and requested letters to the synagogues in Damascus, so that if he found any men or women belonging to the Way, he could bring them as prisoners to Jerusalem.
contents: and requested letters to the synagogues in Damascus, so that if he found any men or women belonging to the Way, he could bring them as prisoners to Jerusalem.

contents.verseText: As Saul drew near to Damascus on his journey, suddenly a light from heaven flashed around him.
contents: As Saul drew near to Damascus on his journey, suddenly a light from heaven flashed around him.

contents.verseText: He fell to the ground and heard a voice say to him, “Saul, Saul, why do you persecute Me?”
contents: He fell to the ground and heard a voice say to him, “Saul, Saul, why do you persecute Me?”

contents.verseText: “Who are You, Lord?” Saul asked. “I am Jesus, whom you are persecuting,” He replied.
contents: “Who are You, Lord?” Saul asked.
“I am Jesus, whom you are persecuting,” He replied.

footnote.ft: TR includes “It is hard for you to kick against the goads.”

contents.verseText: “Now get up and go into the city, and you will be told what you must do.”
contents: “Now get up and go into the city, and you will be told what you must do.”

contents.verseText: The men traveling with Saul stood there speechless. They heard the voice but did not see anyone.
contents: The men traveling with Saul stood there speechless. They heard the voice but did not see anyone.

contents.verseText: Saul got up from the ground, but when he opened his eyes he could not see a thing. So they led him by the hand into Damascus.
contents: Saul got up from the ground, but when he opened his eyes he could not see a thing.

footnote.ft: Literally he could see nothing or he could see no one

contents: So they led him by the hand into Damascus.

contents.verseText: For three days he was without sight, and he did not eat or drink anything.
contents: For three days he was without sight, and he did not eat or drink anything.

contents.verseText: In Damascus there was a disciple named Ananias. The Lord spoke to him in a vision, “Ananias!” “Here I am, Lord,” he answered.
contents: In Damascus there was a disciple named Ananias. The Lord spoke to him in a vision, “Ananias!”
“Here I am, Lord,” he answered.

contents.verseText: “Get up!” the Lord told him. “Go to the house of Judas on Straight Street and ask for a man from Tarsus named Saul, for he is praying.
contents: “Get up!” the Lord told him. “Go to the house of Judas on Straight Street and ask for a man from Tarsus named Saul, for he is praying.

contents.verseText: In a vision he has seen a man named Ananias come and place his hands on him to restore his sight.”
contents: In a vision he has seen a man named Ananias come and place his hands on him to restore his sight.”

contents.verseText: But Ananias answered, “Lord, many people have told me about this man and all the harm he has done to Your saints in Jerusalem.
contents: But Ananias answered, “Lord, many people have told me about this man and all the harm he has done to Your saints in Jerusalem.

contents.verseText: And now he is here with authority from the chief priests to arrest all who call on Your name.”
contents: And now he is here with authority from the chief priests to arrest all who call on Your name.”

contents.verseText: “Go!” said the Lord. “This man is My chosen instrument to carry My name before the Gentiles and their kings, and before the people of Israel.
contents: “Go!” said the Lord. “This man is My chosen instrument to carry My name before the Gentiles and their kings, and before the people of Israel.

contents.verseText: I will show him how much he must suffer for My name.”
contents: I will show him how much he must suffer for My name.”

contents.verseText: So Ananias went to the house, and when he arrived, he placed his hands on Saul. “Brother Saul,” he said, “the Lord Jesus, who appeared to you on the road as you were coming here, has sent me so that you may see again and be filled with the Holy Spirit.”
contents: So Ananias went to the house, and when he arrived, he placed his hands on Saul. “Brother Saul,” he said, “the Lord Jesus, who appeared to you on the road as you were coming here, has sent me so that you may see again and be filled with the Holy Spirit.”

contents.verseText: At that instant, something like scales fell from Saul’s eyes, and his sight was restored. He got up and was baptized,
contents: At that instant, something like scales fell from Saul’s eyes, and his sight was restored. He got up and was baptized,

contents.verseText: and after taking some food, he regained his strength. And he spent several days with the disciples in Damascus.
contents: and after taking some food, he regained his strength. And he spent several days with the disciples in Damascus.

contents.verseText: Saul promptly began to proclaim Jesus in the synagogues, declaring, “He is the Son of God.”
contents: Saul promptly began to proclaim Jesus in the synagogues, declaring, “He is the Son of God.”

contents.verseText: All who heard him were astounded and asked, “Isn’t this the man who wreaked havoc in Jerusalem on those who call on this name? And hasn’t he come here to take them as prisoners to the chief priests?”
contents: All who heard him were astounded and asked, “Isn’t this the man who wreaked havoc in Jerusalem on those who call on this name? And hasn’t he come here to take them as prisoners to the chief priests?”

contents.verseText: But Saul was empowered all the more, and he confounded the Jews living in Damascus by proving that Jesus is the Christ.
contents: But Saul was empowered all the more, and he confounded the Jews living in Damascus by proving that Jesus is the Christ.

contents.verseText: After many days had passed, the Jews conspired to kill him,
contents: After many days had passed, the Jews conspired to kill him,

contents.verseText: but Saul learned of their plot. Day and night they watched the city gates in order to kill him.
contents: but Saul learned of their plot. Day and night they watched the city gates in order to kill him.

contents.verseText: One night, however, his disciples took him and lowered him in a basket through a window in the wall.
contents: One night, however, his disciples took him and lowered him in a basket through a window in the wall.

footnote.ft: Literally through the wall; see 2 Corinthians 11:33.

contents.verseText: When Saul arrived in Jerusalem, he tried to join the disciples, but they were all afraid of him, not believing that he was a disciple.
contents: When Saul arrived in Jerusalem, he tried to join the disciples, but they were all afraid of him, not believing that he was a disciple.

contents.verseText: Then Barnabas brought him to the apostles and described how Saul had seen the Lord, who spoke to him on the road to Damascus, and how Saul had spoken boldly in that city in the name of Jesus.
contents: Then Barnabas brought him to the apostles and described how Saul had seen the Lord, who spoke to him on the road to Damascus, and how Saul had spoken boldly in that city in the name of Jesus.

contents.verseText: So Saul stayed with them, moving about freely in Jerusalem and speaking boldly in the name of the Lord.
contents: So Saul stayed with them, moving about freely in Jerusalem and speaking boldly in the name of the Lord.

contents.verseText: He talked and debated with the Grecian Jews, but they tried to kill him.
contents: He talked and debated with the Grecian Jews,

footnote.ft: Or Hellenists

contents: but they tried to kill him.

contents.verseText: When the brothers learned of this, they took him down to Caesarea and sent him off to Tarsus.
contents: When the brothers learned of this, they took him down to Caesarea and sent him off to Tarsus.

contents.verseText: Then the church throughout Judea, Galilee, and Samaria experienced a time of peace. It grew in strength and numbers, living in the fear of the Lord and the encouragement of the Holy Spirit.
contents: Then the church throughout Judea, Galilee, and Samaria experienced a time of peace. It grew in strength and numbers, living in the fear of the Lord and the encouragement of the Holy Spirit.

contents.verseText: As Peter traveled throughout the area, he went to visit the saints in Lydda.
contents: As Peter traveled throughout the area, he went to visit the saints in Lydda.

contents.verseText: There he found a man named Aeneas, who had been paralyzed and bedridden for eight years.
contents: There he found a man named Aeneas, who had been paralyzed and bedridden for eight years.

contents.verseText: “Aeneas,” Peter said to him, “Jesus Christ heals you! Get up and put away your mat.” Immediately Aeneas got up,
contents: “Aeneas,” Peter said to him, “Jesus Christ heals you! Get up and put away your mat.” Immediately Aeneas got up,

contents.verseText: and all who lived in Lydda and Sharon saw him and turned to the Lord.
contents: and all who lived in Lydda and Sharon saw him and turned to the Lord.

contents.verseText: In Joppa there was a disciple named Tabitha (which is translated as Dorcas), who was always occupied with works of kindness and charity.
contents: In Joppa there was a disciple named Tabitha (which is translated as Dorcas),

footnote.ft: Tabitha in Aramaic and Dorcas in Greek both mean gazelle.

contents: who was always occupied with works of kindness and charity.

contents.verseText: At that time, however, she became sick and died, and her body was washed and placed in an upper room.
contents: At that time, however, she became sick and died, and her body was washed and placed in an upper room.

contents.verseText: Since Lydda was near Joppa, the disciples heard that Peter was there and sent two men to urge him, “Come to us without delay.”
contents: Since Lydda was near Joppa, the disciples heard that Peter was there and sent two men to urge him, “Come to us without delay.”

contents.verseText: So Peter got up and went with them. On his arrival, they took him to the upper room. All the widows stood around him, weeping and showing him the tunics and other clothing that Dorcas had made while she was still with them.
contents: So Peter got up and went with them. On his arrival, they took him to the upper room. All the widows stood around him, weeping and showing him the tunics and other clothing that Dorcas had made while she was still with them.

contents.verseText: Then Peter sent them all out of the room. He knelt down and prayed, and turning toward her body, he said, “Tabitha, get up!” She opened her eyes, and seeing Peter, she sat up.
contents: Then Peter sent them all out of the room. He knelt down and prayed, and turning toward her body, he said, “Tabitha, get up!” She opened her eyes, and seeing Peter, she sat up.

contents.verseText: Peter took her by the hand and helped her up. Then he called the saints and widows and presented her to them alive.
contents: Peter took her by the hand and helped her up. Then he called the saints and widows and presented her to them alive.

contents.verseText: This became known all over Joppa, and many people believed in the Lord.
contents: This became known all over Joppa, and many people believed in the Lord.

contents.verseText: And Peter stayed for several days in Joppa with a tanner named Simon.
contents: And Peter stayed for several days in Joppa with a tanner named Simon.

contents.verseText: At Caesarea there was a man named Cornelius, a centurion in what was called the Italian Regiment.
contents: At Caesarea there was a man named Cornelius, a centurion in what was called the Italian Regiment.

contents.verseText: He and all his household were devout and God-fearing. He gave generously to the people and prayed to God regularly.
contents: He and all his household were devout and God-fearing. He gave generously to the people and prayed to God regularly.

contents.verseText: One day at about the ninth hour, he had a clear vision of an angel of God who came to him and said, “Cornelius!”
contents: One day at about the ninth hour,

footnote.ft: That is, about three in the afternoon; also in verse 30

contents: he had a clear vision of an angel of God who came to him and said, “Cornelius!”

contents.verseText: Cornelius stared at him in fear and asked, “What is it, Lord?” The angel answered, “Your prayers and gifts to the poor have ascended as a memorial offering before God.
contents: Cornelius stared at him in fear and asked, “What is it, Lord?”
The angel answered, “Your prayers and gifts to the poor have ascended as a memorial offering before God.

contents.verseText: Now send men to Joppa to call for a man named Simon who is called Peter.
contents: Now send men to Joppa to call for a man named Simon who is called Peter.

contents.verseText: He is staying with Simon the tanner, whose house is by the sea.”
contents: He is staying with Simon the tanner, whose house is by the sea.

footnote.ft: TR includes He will tell you what you need to do.

contents.verseText: When the angel who spoke to him had gone, Cornelius called two of his servants and a devout soldier from among his attendants.
contents: When the angel who spoke to him had gone, Cornelius called two of his servants and a devout soldier from among his attendants.

contents.verseText: He explained what had happened and sent them to Joppa.
contents: He explained what had happened and sent them to Joppa.

contents.verseText: The next day at about the sixth hour, as the men were approaching the city on their journey, Peter went up on the roof to pray.
contents: The next day at about the sixth hour,

footnote.ft: That is, about noon

contents: as the men were approaching the city on their journey, Peter went up on the roof to pray.

contents.verseText: He became hungry and wanted something to eat, but while the meal was being prepared, he fell into a trance.
contents: He became hungry and wanted something to eat, but while the meal was being prepared, he fell into a trance.

contents.verseText: He saw heaven open and something like a large sheet being let down to earth by its four corners.
contents: He saw heaven open and something like a large sheet being let down to earth by its four corners.

contents.verseText: It contained all kinds of four-footed animals and reptiles of the earth, as well as birds of the air.
contents: It contained all kinds of four-footed animals and reptiles of the earth, as well as birds of the air.

contents.verseText: Then a voice said to him: “Get up, Peter, kill and eat!”
contents: Then a voice said to him: “Get up, Peter, kill and eat!”

contents.verseText: “No, Lord!” Peter answered. “I have never eaten anything impure or unclean.”
contents: “No, Lord!” Peter answered. “I have never eaten anything impure

footnote.ft: Literally common; similarly in verses 15 and 28

contents: or unclean.”

contents.verseText: The voice spoke to him a second time: “Do not call anything impure that God has made clean.”
contents: The voice spoke to him a second time: “Do not call anything impure that God has made clean.”

contents.verseText: This happened three times, and all at once the sheet was taken back up into heaven.
contents: This happened three times, and all at once the sheet was taken back up into heaven.

contents.verseText: While Peter was puzzling over the meaning of the vision, the men sent by Cornelius found Simon’s house and approached the gate.
contents: While Peter was puzzling over the meaning of the vision, the men sent by Cornelius found Simon’s house and approached the gate.

contents.verseText: They called out to ask if Simon called Peter was staying there.
contents: They called out to ask if Simon called Peter was staying there.

contents.verseText: As Peter continued to reflect on the vision, the Spirit said to him, “Behold, three men are looking for you.
contents: As Peter continued to reflect on the vision, the Spirit said to him, “Behold, three men are looking for you.

footnote.ft: ECM, NA, and TR; NE and WH two men are looking for you; SBL, BYZ, and Tischendorf men are looking for you

contents.verseText: So get up! Go downstairs and accompany them without hesitation, because I have sent them.”
contents: So get up! Go downstairs and accompany them without hesitation, because I have sent them.”

contents.verseText: So Peter went down to the men and said, “Here am I, the one you are looking for. Why have you come?”
contents: So Peter went down to the men

footnote.ft: TR the men sent to him by Cornelius

contents: and said, “Here am I, the one you are looking for. Why have you come?”

contents.verseText: “Cornelius the centurion has sent us,” they said. “He is a righteous and God-fearing man with a good reputation among the whole Jewish nation. A holy angel instructed him to request your presence in his home so he could hear a message from you.”
contents: “Cornelius the centurion has sent us,” they said. “He is a righteous and God-fearing man with a good reputation among the whole Jewish nation. A holy angel instructed him to request your presence in his home so he could hear a message from you.”

contents.verseText: So Peter invited them in as his guests. And the next day he got ready and went with them, accompanied by some of the brothers from Joppa.
contents: So Peter invited them in as his guests. And the next day he got ready and went with them, accompanied by some of the brothers from Joppa.

contents.verseText: The following day he arrived in Caesarea, where Cornelius was expecting them and had called together his relatives and close friends.
contents: The following day he arrived in Caesarea, where Cornelius was expecting them and had called together his relatives and close friends.

contents.verseText: As Peter was about to enter, Cornelius met him and fell at his feet to worship him.
contents: As Peter was about to enter, Cornelius met him and fell at his feet to worship him.

contents.verseText: But Peter helped him up. “Stand up,” he said, “I am only a man myself.”
contents: But Peter helped him up. “Stand up,” he said, “I am only a man myself.”

contents.verseText: As Peter talked with him, he went inside and found many people gathered together.
contents: As Peter talked with him, he went inside and found many people gathered together.

contents.verseText: He said to them, “You know how unlawful it is for a Jew to associate with a foreigner or visit him. But God has shown me that I should not call any man impure or unclean.
contents: He said to them, “You know how unlawful it is for a Jew to associate with a foreigner or visit him. But God has shown me that I should not call any man impure or unclean.

contents.verseText: So when I was invited, I came without objection. I ask, then, why have you sent for me?”
contents: So when I was invited, I came without objection. I ask, then, why have you sent for me?”

contents.verseText: Cornelius answered: “Four days ago I was in my house praying at this, the ninth hour. Suddenly a man in radiant clothing stood before me
contents: Cornelius answered: “Four days ago I was in my house praying at this, the ninth hour.

footnote.ft: BYZ and TR Four days ago I was fasting until this hour, and at the ninth hour I was praying in my house.

contents: Suddenly a man in radiant clothing stood before me

contents.verseText: and said, ‘Cornelius, your prayer has been heard, and your gifts to the poor have been remembered before God.
contents: and said, ‘Cornelius, your prayer has been heard, and your gifts to the poor have been remembered before God.

contents.verseText: Therefore send to Joppa for Simon, who is called Peter. He is a guest in the home of Simon the tanner, by the sea.’
contents: Therefore send to Joppa for Simon, who is called Peter. He is a guest in the home of Simon the tanner, by the sea.’

contents.verseText: So I sent for you immediately, and you were kind enough to come. Now then, we are all here in the presence of God to listen to everything the Lord has instructed you to tell us.”
contents: So I sent for you immediately, and you were kind enough to come. Now then, we are all here in the presence of God to listen to everything the Lord has instructed you to tell us.”

contents.verseText: Then Peter began to speak: “I now truly understand that God does not show favoritism,
contents: Then Peter began to speak: “I now truly understand that God does not show favoritism,

contents.verseText: but welcomes those from every nation who fear Him and do what is right.
contents: but welcomes those from every nation who fear Him and do what is right.

contents.verseText: He has sent this message to the people of Israel, proclaiming the gospel of peace through Jesus Christ, who is Lord of all.
contents: He has sent this message to the people of Israel, proclaiming the gospel of peace through Jesus Christ, who is Lord of all.

contents.verseText: You yourselves know what has happened throughout Judea, beginning in Galilee with the baptism that John proclaimed:
contents: You yourselves know what has happened throughout Judea, beginning in Galilee with the baptism that John proclaimed:

contents.verseText: how God anointed Jesus of Nazareth with the Holy Spirit and with power, and how Jesus went around doing good and healing all who were oppressed by the devil, because God was with Him.
contents: how God anointed Jesus of Nazareth with the Holy Spirit and with power, and how Jesus went around doing good and healing all who were oppressed by the devil, because God was with Him.

contents.verseText: We are witnesses of all that He did, both in the land of the Jews and in Jerusalem. And although they put Him to death by hanging Him on a tree,
contents: We are witnesses of all that He did, both in the land of the Jews and in Jerusalem. And although they put Him to death by hanging Him on a tree,

contents.verseText: God raised Him up on the third day and caused Him to be seen—
contents: God raised Him up on the third day and caused Him to be seen—

contents.verseText: not by all the people, but by the witnesses God had chosen beforehand, by us who ate and drank with Him after He rose from the dead.
contents: not by all the people, but by the witnesses God had chosen beforehand, by us who ate and drank with Him after He rose from the dead.

contents.verseText: And He commanded us to preach to the people and to testify that He is the One appointed by God to judge the living and the dead.
contents: And He commanded us to preach to the people and to testify that He is the One appointed by God to judge the living and the dead.

contents.verseText: All the prophets testify about Him that everyone who believes in Him receives forgiveness of sins through His name.”
contents: All the prophets testify about Him that everyone who believes in Him receives forgiveness of sins through His name.”

s1: The Gentiles Receive the Holy Spirit

contents.verseText: While Peter was still speaking these words, the Holy Spirit fell upon all who heard his message.
contents: While Peter was still speaking these words, the Holy Spirit fell upon all who heard his message.

contents.verseText: All the circumcised believers who had accompanied Peter were astounded that the gift of the Holy Spirit had been poured out even on the Gentiles.
contents: All the circumcised believers who had accompanied Peter were astounded that the gift of the Holy Spirit had been poured out even on the Gentiles.

contents.verseText: For they heard them speaking in tongues and exalting God. Then Peter said,
contents: For they heard them speaking in tongues and exalting God.
Then Peter said,

contents.verseText: “Can anyone withhold the water to baptize these people? They have received the Holy Spirit just as we have!”
contents: “Can anyone withhold the water to baptize these people? They have received the Holy Spirit just as we have!”

contents.verseText: So he ordered that they be baptized in the name of Jesus Christ. Then they asked him to stay for a few days.
contents: So he ordered that they be baptized in the name of Jesus Christ. Then they asked him to stay for a few days.

contents.verseText: The apostles and brothers throughout Judea soon heard that the Gentiles also had received the word of God.
contents: The apostles and brothers throughout Judea soon heard that the Gentiles also had received the word of God.

contents.verseText: So when Peter went up to Jerusalem, the circumcised believers took issue with him
contents: So when Peter went up to Jerusalem, the circumcised believers

footnote.ft: Literally those of the circumcision

contents: took issue with him

contents.verseText: and said, “You visited uncircumcised men and ate with them.”
contents: and said, “You visited uncircumcised men and ate with them.”

contents.verseText: But Peter began and explained to them the whole sequence of events:
contents: But Peter began and explained to them the whole sequence of events:

contents.verseText: “I was in the city of Joppa praying, and in a trance I saw a vision of something like a large sheet being let down from heaven by its four corners, and it came right down to me.
contents: “I was in the city of Joppa praying, and in a trance I saw a vision of something like a large sheet being let down from heaven by its four corners, and it came right down to me.

contents.verseText: I looked at it closely and saw four-footed animals of the earth, wild beasts, reptiles, and birds of the air.
contents: I looked at it closely and saw four-footed animals of the earth, wild beasts, reptiles, and birds of the air.

contents.verseText: Then I heard a voice saying to me, ‘Get up, Peter, kill and eat.’
contents: Then I heard a voice saying to me, ‘Get up, Peter, kill and eat.’

contents.verseText: ‘No, Lord,’ I said, ‘for nothing impure or unclean has ever entered my mouth.’
contents: ‘No, Lord,’ I said, ‘for nothing impure

footnote.ft: Literally common; similarly in verse 9

contents: or unclean has ever entered my mouth.’

contents.verseText: But the voice spoke from heaven a second time, ‘Do not call anything impure that God has made clean.’
contents: But the voice spoke from heaven a second time, ‘Do not call anything impure that God has made clean.’

contents.verseText: This happened three times, and everything was drawn back up into heaven.
contents: This happened three times, and everything was drawn back up into heaven.

contents.verseText: Just then three men sent to me from Caesarea stopped at the house where I was staying.
contents: Just then three men sent to me from Caesarea stopped at the house where I was staying.

contents.verseText: The Spirit told me to accompany them without hesitation. These six brothers also went with me, and we entered the man’s home.
contents: The Spirit told me to accompany them without hesitation. These six brothers also went with me, and we entered the man’s home.

contents.verseText: He told us how he had seen an angel standing in his house and saying, ‘Send to Joppa for Simon who is called Peter.
contents: He told us how he had seen an angel standing in his house and saying, ‘Send to Joppa for Simon who is called Peter.

contents.verseText: He will convey to you a message by which you and all your household will be saved.’
contents: He will convey to you a message by which you and all your household will be saved.’

contents.verseText: As I began to speak, the Holy Spirit fell upon them, just as He had fallen upon us at the beginning.
contents: As I began to speak, the Holy Spirit fell upon them, just as He had fallen upon us at the beginning.

contents.verseText: Then I remembered the word of the Lord, as He used to say, ‘John baptized with water, but you will be baptized with the Holy Spirit.’
contents: Then I remembered the word of the Lord, as He used to say, ‘John baptized with water, but you will be baptized with the Holy Spirit.’

footnote.ft: Or ‘John baptized in water, but in a few days you will be baptized in the Holy Spirit.’ Acts 1:5

contents.verseText: So if God gave them the same gift He gave us who believed in the Lord Jesus Christ, who was I to hinder the work of God?”
contents: So if God gave them the same gift He gave us who believed in the Lord Jesus Christ, who was I to hinder the work of God?”

contents.verseText: When they heard this, their objections were put to rest, and they glorified God, saying, “So then, God has granted even the Gentiles repentance unto life.”
contents: When they heard this, their objections were put to rest, and they glorified God, saying, “So then, God has granted even the Gentiles repentance unto life.”

contents.verseText: Meanwhile those scattered by the persecution that began with Stephen traveled as far as Phoenicia, Cyprus, and Antioch, speaking the message only to Jews.
contents: Meanwhile those scattered by the persecution that began with Stephen traveled as far as Phoenicia, Cyprus, and Antioch, speaking the message only to Jews.

contents.verseText: But some of them, men from Cyprus and Cyrene, went to Antioch and began speaking to the Greeks as well, proclaiming the good news about the Lord Jesus.
contents: But some of them, men from Cyprus and Cyrene, went to Antioch and began speaking to the Greeks

footnote.ft: Or the Hellenists

contents: as well, proclaiming the good news about the Lord Jesus.

contents.verseText: The hand of the Lord was with them, and a great number of people believed and turned to the Lord.
contents: The hand of the Lord was with them, and a great number of people believed and turned to the Lord.

contents.verseText: When news of this reached the ears of the church in Jerusalem, they sent Barnabas to Antioch.
contents: When news of this reached the ears of the church in Jerusalem, they sent Barnabas to Antioch.

contents.verseText: When he arrived and saw the grace of God, he rejoiced and encouraged them all to abide in the Lord with all their hearts.
contents: When he arrived and saw the grace of God, he rejoiced and encouraged them all to abide in the Lord with all their hearts.

contents.verseText: Barnabas was a good man, full of the Holy Spirit and faith, and a great number of people were brought to the Lord.
contents: Barnabas was a good man, full of the Holy Spirit and faith, and a great number of people were brought to the Lord.

contents.verseText: Then Barnabas went to Tarsus to look for Saul,
contents: Then Barnabas went to Tarsus to look for Saul,

contents.verseText: and when he found him, he brought him back to Antioch. So for a full year they met together with the church and taught large numbers of people. The disciples were first called Christians at Antioch.
contents: and when he found him, he brought him back to Antioch. So for a full year they met together with the church and taught large numbers of people. The disciples were first called Christians at Antioch.

contents.verseText: In those days some prophets came down from Jerusalem to Antioch.
contents: In those days some prophets came down from Jerusalem to Antioch.

contents.verseText: One of them named Agabus stood up and predicted through the Spirit that a great famine would sweep across the whole world. (This happened under Claudius.)
contents: One of them named Agabus stood up and predicted through the Spirit that a great famine would sweep across the whole world.

footnote.ft: Or the entire Roman world

contents: (This happened under Claudius.)

contents.verseText: So the disciples, each according to his ability, decided to send relief to the brothers living in Judea.
contents: So the disciples, each according to his ability, decided to send relief to the brothers living in Judea.

contents.verseText: This they did, sending their gifts to the elders with Barnabas and Saul.
contents: This they did, sending their gifts to the elders with Barnabas and Saul.

contents.verseText: About that time, King Herod reached out to harm some who belonged to the church.
contents: About that time, King Herod

footnote.ft: That is, King Herod Agrippa

contents: reached out to harm

footnote.ft: Literally put forth the hands to mistreat

contents: some who belonged to the church.

contents.verseText: He had James, the brother of John, put to death with the sword.
contents: He had James, the brother of John, put to death with the sword.

contents.verseText: And seeing that this pleased the Jews, Herod proceeded to seize Peter during the Feast of Unleavened Bread.
contents: And seeing that this pleased the Jews, Herod proceeded to seize Peter during the Feast of Unleavened Bread.

footnote.ft: Literally seize Peter—now these were the days of the Unleavened; see Exodus 12:14–20.

contents.verseText: He arrested him and put him in prison, handing him over to be guarded by four squads of four soldiers each. Herod intended to bring him out to the people after the Passover.
contents: He arrested him and put him in prison, handing him over to be guarded by four squads of four soldiers each. Herod intended to bring him out to the people after the Passover.

contents.verseText: So Peter was kept in prison, but the church was fervently praying to God for him.
contents: So Peter was kept in prison, but the church was fervently praying to God for him.

contents.verseText: On the night before Herod was to bring him to trial, Peter was sleeping between two soldiers, bound with two chains, with sentries standing guard at the entrance to the prison.
contents: On the night before Herod was to bring him to trial, Peter was sleeping between two soldiers, bound with two chains, with sentries standing guard at the entrance to the prison.

contents.verseText: Suddenly an angel of the Lord appeared and a light shone in the cell. He tapped Peter on the side and woke him up, saying, “Get up quickly.” And the chains fell off his wrists.
contents: Suddenly an angel of the Lord appeared and a light shone in the cell. He tapped Peter on the side and woke him up, saying, “Get up quickly.” And the chains fell off his wrists.

contents.verseText: “Get dressed and put on your sandals,” said the angel. Peter did so, and the angel told him, “Wrap your cloak around you and follow me.”
contents: “Get dressed and put on your sandals,” said the angel. Peter did so, and the angel told him, “Wrap your cloak around you and follow me.”

contents.verseText: So Peter followed him out, but he was unaware that what the angel was doing was real. He thought he was only seeing a vision.
contents: So Peter followed him out, but he was unaware that what the angel was doing was real. He thought he was only seeing a vision.

contents.verseText: They passed the first and second guards and came to the iron gate leading to the city, which opened for them by itself. When they had gone outside and walked the length of one block, the angel suddenly left him.
contents: They passed the first and second guards and came to the iron gate leading to the city, which opened for them by itself. When they had gone outside and walked the length of one block, the angel suddenly left him.

contents.verseText: Then Peter came to himself and said, “Now I know for sure that the Lord has sent His angel and rescued me from Herod’s grasp and from everything the Jewish people were anticipating.”
contents: Then Peter came to himself and said, “Now I know for sure that the Lord has sent His angel and rescued me from Herod’s grasp and from everything the Jewish people were anticipating.”

contents.verseText: And when he had realized this, he went to the house of Mary the mother of John, also called Mark, where many people had gathered together and were praying.
contents: And when he had realized this, he went to the house of Mary the mother of John, also called Mark, where many people had gathered together and were praying.

contents.verseText: He knocked at the outer gate, and a servant girl named Rhoda came to answer it.
contents: He knocked at the outer gate, and a servant girl named Rhoda came to answer it.

contents.verseText: When she recognized Peter’s voice, she was so overjoyed that she forgot to open the gate, but ran inside and announced, “Peter is standing at the gate!”
contents: When she recognized Peter’s voice, she was so overjoyed that she forgot to open the gate, but ran inside and announced, “Peter is standing at the gate!”

contents.verseText: “You are out of your mind,” they told her. But when she kept insisting it was so, they said, “It must be his angel.”
contents: “You are out of your mind,” they told her. But when she kept insisting it was so, they said, “It must be his angel.”

contents.verseText: But Peter kept on knocking, and when they opened the door and saw him, they were astounded.
contents: But Peter kept on knocking, and when they opened the door and saw him, they were astounded.

contents.verseText: Peter motioned with his hand for silence, and he described how the Lord had brought him out of the prison. “Send word to James and to the brothers,” he said, and he left for another place.
contents: Peter motioned with his hand for silence, and he described how the Lord had brought him out of the prison. “Send word to James and to the brothers,” he said, and he left for another place.

contents.verseText: At daybreak there was no small commotion among the soldiers as to what had become of Peter.
contents: At daybreak there was no small commotion among the soldiers as to what had become of Peter.

contents.verseText: After Herod had searched for him unsuccessfully, he examined the guards and ordered that they be executed. Then he went down from Judea to Caesarea and spent some time there.
contents: After Herod had searched for him unsuccessfully, he examined the guards and ordered that they be executed. Then he went down from Judea to Caesarea and spent some time there.

contents.verseText: Now Herod was in a furious dispute with the people of Tyre and Sidon, and they convened before him. Having secured the support of Blastus, the king’s chamberlain, they asked for peace, because their region depended on the king’s country for food.
contents: Now Herod was in a furious dispute

footnote.ft: Or had become furious

contents: with the people of Tyre and Sidon, and they convened before him. Having secured the support of Blastus, the king’s chamberlain, they asked for peace, because their region depended on the king’s country for food.

contents.verseText: On the appointed day, Herod donned his royal robes, sat on his throne, and addressed the people.
contents: On the appointed day, Herod donned his royal robes, sat on his throne, and addressed the people.

contents.verseText: And they began to shout, “This is the voice of a god, not a man!”
contents: And they began to shout, “This is the voice of a god, not a man!”

contents.verseText: Immediately, because Herod did not give glory to God, an angel of the Lord struck him down, and he was eaten by worms and died.
contents: Immediately, because Herod did not give glory to God, an angel of the Lord struck him down, and he was eaten by worms and died.

contents.verseText: But the word of God continued to spread and multiply.
contents: But the word of God continued to spread and multiply.

contents.verseText: When Barnabas and Saul had fulfilled their mission to Jerusalem, they returned, bringing with them John, also called Mark.
contents: When Barnabas and Saul had fulfilled their mission to Jerusalem, they returned,

footnote.ft: Or had fulfilled their mission, they returned to Jerusalem; NE and TR had fulfilled their mission, they returned from Jerusalem

contents: bringing with them John, also called Mark.

contents.verseText: Now in the church at Antioch there were prophets and teachers: Barnabas, Simeon called Niger, Lucius of Cyrene, Manaen (who had been brought up with Herod the tetrarch), and Saul.
contents: Now in the church at Antioch there were prophets and teachers: Barnabas, Simeon called Niger, Lucius of Cyrene, Manaen (who had been brought up with Herod the tetrarch), and Saul.

contents.verseText: While they were worshiping the Lord and fasting, the Holy Spirit said, “Set apart for Me Barnabas and Saul for the work to which I have called them.”
contents: While they were worshiping the Lord and fasting, the Holy Spirit said, “Set apart for Me Barnabas and Saul for the work to which I have called them.”

contents.verseText: And after they had fasted and prayed, they laid their hands on them and sent them off.
contents: And after they had fasted and prayed, they laid their hands on them and sent them off.

contents.verseText: So Barnabas and Saul, sent forth by the Holy Spirit, went down to Seleucia and sailed from there to Cyprus.
contents: So Barnabas and Saul, sent forth by the Holy Spirit, went down to Seleucia and sailed from there to Cyprus.

contents.verseText: When they arrived at Salamis, they proclaimed the word of God in the Jewish synagogues. And John was with them as their helper.
contents: When they arrived at Salamis, they proclaimed the word of God in the Jewish synagogues. And John was with them as their helper.

contents.verseText: They traveled through the whole island as far as Paphos, where they found a Jewish sorcerer and false prophet named Bar-Jesus,
contents: They traveled through the whole island as far as Paphos, where they found a Jewish sorcerer and false prophet named Bar-Jesus,

contents.verseText: an attendant of the proconsul, Sergius Paulus. The proconsul, a man of intelligence, summoned Barnabas and Saul because he wanted to hear the word of God.
contents: an attendant of the proconsul, Sergius Paulus. The proconsul, a man of intelligence, summoned Barnabas and Saul because he wanted to hear the word of God.

contents.verseText: But Elymas the sorcerer (for that is what his name means) opposed them and tried to turn the proconsul from the faith.
contents: But Elymas the sorcerer (for that is what his name means) opposed them and tried to turn the proconsul from the faith.

contents.verseText: Then Saul, who was also called Paul, filled with the Holy Spirit, looked directly at Elymas
contents: Then Saul, who was also called Paul, filled with the Holy Spirit, looked directly at Elymas

contents.verseText: and said, “O child of the devil and enemy of all righteousness, you are full of all kinds of deceit and trickery! Will you never stop perverting the straight ways of the Lord?
contents: and said, “O child of the devil and enemy of all righteousness, you are full of all kinds of deceit and trickery! Will you never stop perverting the straight ways of the Lord?

contents.verseText: Now look, the hand of the Lord is against you, and for a time you will be blind and unable to see the light of the sun.” Immediately mist and darkness came over him, and he groped about, seeking someone to lead him by the hand.
contents: Now look, the hand of the Lord is against you, and for a time you will be blind and unable to see the light of the sun.” Immediately mist and darkness came over him, and he groped about, seeking someone to lead him by the hand.

contents.verseText: When the proconsul saw what had happened, he believed, for he was astonished at the teaching about the Lord.
contents: When the proconsul saw what had happened, he believed, for he was astonished at the teaching about the Lord.

contents.verseText: After setting sail from Paphos, Paul and his companions came to Perga in Pamphylia, where John left them to return to Jerusalem.
contents: After setting sail from Paphos, Paul and his companions came to Perga in Pamphylia, where John left them to return to Jerusalem.

contents.verseText: And from Perga, they traveled inland to Pisidian Antioch, where they entered the synagogue on the Sabbath and sat down.
contents: And from Perga, they traveled inland to Pisidian Antioch, where they entered the synagogue on the Sabbath and sat down.

contents.verseText: After the reading from the Law and the Prophets, the synagogue leaders sent word to them: “Brothers, if you have a word of encouragement for the people, please speak.”
contents: After the reading from the Law and the Prophets, the synagogue leaders sent word to them: “Brothers, if you have a word of encouragement for the people, please speak.”

contents.verseText: Paul stood up, motioned with his hand, and began to speak: “Men of Israel and you Gentiles who fear God, listen to me!
contents: Paul stood up, motioned with his hand, and began to speak: “Men of Israel and you Gentiles who fear God, listen to me!

contents.verseText: The God of the people of Israel chose our fathers. He made them into a great people during their stay in Egypt, and with an uplifted arm He led them out of that land.
contents: The God of the people of Israel chose our fathers. He made them into a great people during their stay in Egypt, and with an uplifted arm He led them out of that land.

contents.verseText: He endured their conduct for about forty years in the wilderness.
contents: He endured their conduct for about forty years in the wilderness.

contents.verseText: And having vanquished seven nations in Canaan, He gave their land to His people as an inheritance.
contents: And having vanquished seven nations in Canaan, He gave their land to His people as an inheritance.

contents.verseText: All this took about 450 years. After this, God gave them judges until the time of Samuel the prophet.
contents: All this took about 450 years.
After this, God gave them judges until the time of Samuel the prophet.

contents.verseText: Then the people asked for a king, and God gave them forty years under Saul son of Kish, from the tribe of Benjamin.
contents: Then the people asked for a king, and God gave them forty years under Saul son of Kish, from the tribe of Benjamin.

contents.verseText: After removing Saul, He raised up David as their king and testified about him: ‘I have found David son of Jesse a man after My own heart; he will carry out My will in its entirety.’
contents: After removing Saul, He raised up David as their king and testified about him: ‘I have found David son of Jesse a man after My own heart; he will carry out My will in its entirety.’

footnote.ft: See 1 Samuel 13:14.

contents.verseText: From the descendants of this man, God has brought to Israel the Savior Jesus, as He promised.
contents: From the descendants of this man, God has brought to Israel the Savior Jesus, as He promised.

contents.verseText: Before the arrival of Jesus, John preached a baptism of repentance to all the people of Israel.
contents: Before the arrival of Jesus, John preached a baptism of repentance to all the people of Israel.

contents.verseText: As John was completing his course, he said, ‘Who do you suppose I am? I am not that One. But He is coming after me whose sandals I am not worthy to untie.’
contents: As John was completing his course, he said, ‘Who do you suppose I am? I am not that One. But He is coming after me whose sandals I am not worthy to untie.’

footnote.ft: Luke 3:16; see also Matthew 3:11, Mark 1:7, and John 1:27.

contents.verseText: Brothers, children of Abraham, and you Gentiles who fear God, it is to us that this message of salvation has been sent.
contents: Brothers, children of Abraham, and you Gentiles who fear God, it is to us that this message of salvation has been sent.

contents.verseText: The people of Jerusalem and their rulers did not recognize Jesus, yet in condemning Him they fulfilled the words of the prophets that are read every Sabbath.
contents: The people of Jerusalem and their rulers did not recognize Jesus, yet in condemning Him they fulfilled the words of the prophets that are read every Sabbath.

contents.verseText: And though they found no ground for a death sentence, they asked Pilate to have Him executed.
contents: And though they found no ground for a death sentence, they asked Pilate to have Him executed.

contents.verseText: When they had carried out all that was written about Him, they took Him down from the tree and laid Him in a tomb.
contents: When they had carried out all that was written about Him, they took Him down from the tree and laid Him in a tomb.

contents.verseText: But God raised Him from the dead,
contents: But God raised Him from the dead,

contents.verseText: and for many days He was seen by those who had accompanied Him from Galilee to Jerusalem. They are now His witnesses to our people.
contents: and for many days He was seen by those who had accompanied Him from Galilee to Jerusalem. They are now His witnesses to our people.

contents.verseText: And now we proclaim to you the good news: What God promised our fathers
contents: And now we proclaim to you the good news: What God promised our fathers

contents.verseText: He has fulfilled for us, their children, by raising up Jesus. As it is written in the second Psalm: ‘You are My Son; today I have become Your Father.’
contents: He has fulfilled for us, their children, by raising up Jesus. As it is written in the second Psalm:
‘You are My Son;
today I have become Your Father.’

footnote.ft: Psalm 2:7; literally today I have begotten You

contents.verseText: In fact, God raised Him from the dead, never to see decay. As He has said: ‘I will give you the holy and sure blessings promised to David.’
contents: In fact, God raised Him from the dead, never to see decay. As He has said:
‘I will give you the holy and sure blessings promised to David.’

footnote.ft: Literally I will give you the holy, the trustworthy of David; Isaiah 55:3

contents.verseText: So also, He says in another Psalm: ‘You will not let Your Holy One see decay.’
contents: So also, He says in another Psalm:
‘You will not let Your Holy One see decay.’

contents.verseText: For when David had served God’s purpose in his own generation, he fell asleep. His body was buried with his fathers and saw decay.
contents: For when David had served God’s purpose in his own generation, he fell asleep. His body was buried with his fathers and saw decay.

contents.verseText: But the One whom God raised from the dead did not see decay.
contents: But the One whom God raised from the dead did not see decay.

contents.verseText: Therefore let it be known to you, brothers, that through Jesus the forgiveness of sins is proclaimed to you.
contents: Therefore let it be known to you, brothers, that through Jesus the forgiveness of sins is proclaimed to you.

contents.verseText: Through Him everyone who believes is justified from everything you could not be justified from by the law of Moses.
contents: Through Him everyone who believes is justified from everything you could not be justified from by the law of Moses.

contents.verseText: Watch out, then, that what was spoken by the prophets does not happen to you:
contents: Watch out, then, that what was spoken by the prophets does not happen to you:

contents.verseText: ‘Look, you scoffers, wonder and perish! For I am doing a work in your days that you would never believe, even if someone told you.’”
contents: ‘Look, you scoffers,
wonder and perish!
For I am doing a work in your days
that you would never believe,
even if someone told you.’
