contents.verseText: As Paul and Barnabas were leaving the synagogue, the people urged them to continue this message on the next Sabbath.
contents: As Paul and Barnabas were leaving the synagogue, the people urged them to continue this message on the next Sabbath.

contents.verseText: After the synagogue was dismissed, many of the Jews and devout converts to Judaism followed Paul and Barnabas, who spoke to them and urged them to continue in the grace of God.
contents: After the synagogue was dismissed, many of the Jews and devout converts to Judaism followed Paul and Barnabas, who spoke to them and urged them to continue in the grace of God.

contents.verseText: On the following Sabbath, nearly the whole city gathered to hear the word of the Lord.
contents: On the following Sabbath, nearly the whole city gathered to hear the word of the Lord.

contents.verseText: But when the Jews saw the crowds, they were filled with jealousy, and they blasphemously contradicted what Paul was saying.
contents: But when the Jews saw the crowds, they were filled with jealousy, and they blasphemously contradicted what Paul was saying.

contents.verseText: Then Paul and Barnabas answered them boldly: “It was necessary to speak the word of God to you first. But since you reject it and do not consider yourselves worthy of eternal life, we now turn to the Gentiles.
contents: Then Paul and Barnabas answered them boldly: “It was necessary to speak the word of God to you first. But since you reject it and do not consider yourselves worthy of eternal life, we now turn to the Gentiles.

contents.verseText: For this is what the Lord has commanded us: ‘I have made you a light for the Gentiles, to bring salvation to the ends of the earth.’”
contents: For this is what the Lord has commanded us:
‘I have made you a light for the Gentiles,
to bring salvation to the ends of the earth.’

footnote.ft: Isaiah 49:6

contents.verseText: When the Gentiles heard this, they rejoiced and glorified the word of the Lord, and all who were appointed for eternal life believed.
contents: When the Gentiles heard this, they rejoiced and glorified the word of the Lord, and all who were appointed for eternal life believed.

contents.verseText: And the word of the Lord spread throughout that region.
contents: And the word of the Lord spread throughout that region.

contents.verseText: The Jews, however, incited the religious women of prominence and the leading men of the city. They stirred up persecution against Paul and Barnabas and drove them out of their district.
contents: The Jews, however, incited the religious women of prominence and the leading men of the city. They stirred up persecution against Paul and Barnabas and drove them out of their district.

contents.verseText: So they shook the dust off their feet in protest against them and went to Iconium.
contents: So they shook the dust off their feet in protest against them and went to Iconium.

contents.verseText: And the disciples were filled with joy and with the Holy Spirit.
contents: And the disciples were filled with joy and with the Holy Spirit.

contents.verseText: At Iconium, Paul and Barnabas went as usual into the Jewish synagogue, where they spoke so well that a great number of Jews and Greeks believed.
contents: At Iconium, Paul and Barnabas went as usual into the Jewish synagogue, where they spoke so well that a great number of Jews and Greeks believed.

contents.verseText: But the unbelieving Jews stirred up the Gentiles and poisoned their minds against the brothers.
contents: But the unbelieving Jews stirred up the Gentiles and poisoned their minds against the brothers.

contents.verseText: So Paul and Barnabas spent considerable time there, speaking boldly for the Lord, who affirmed the message of His grace by enabling them to perform signs and wonders.
contents: So Paul and Barnabas spent considerable time there, speaking boldly for the Lord, who affirmed the message of His grace by enabling them to perform signs and wonders.

contents.verseText: The people of the city were divided. Some sided with the Jews, and others with the apostles.
contents: The people of the city were divided. Some sided with the Jews, and others with the apostles.

contents.verseText: But when the Gentiles and Jews, together with their rulers, set out to mistreat and stone them,
contents: But when the Gentiles and Jews, together with their rulers, set out to mistreat and stone them,

contents.verseText: they found out about it and fled to the Lycaonian cities of Lystra and Derbe and to the surrounding region,
contents: they found out about it and fled to the Lycaonian cities of Lystra and Derbe and to the surrounding region,

contents.verseText: where they continued to preach the gospel.
contents: where they continued to preach the gospel.

s1: The Visit to Lystra and Derbe

contents.verseText: In Lystra there sat a man crippled in his feet, who was lame from birth and had never walked.
contents: In Lystra there sat a man crippled in his feet, who was lame from birth and had never walked.

contents.verseText: This man was listening to the words of Paul, who looked intently at him and saw that he had faith to be healed.
contents: This man was listening to the words of Paul, who looked intently at him and saw that he had faith to be healed.

contents.verseText: In a loud voice Paul called out, “Stand up on your feet!” And the man jumped up and began to walk.
contents: In a loud voice Paul called out, “Stand up on your feet!” And the man jumped up and began to walk.

contents.verseText: When the crowds saw what Paul had done, they lifted up their voices in the Lycaonian language: “The gods have come down to us in human form!”
contents: When the crowds saw what Paul had done, they lifted up their voices in the Lycaonian language: “The gods have come down to us in human form!”

contents.verseText: Barnabas they called Zeus, and Paul they called Hermes, because he was the chief speaker.
contents: Barnabas they called Zeus, and Paul they called Hermes, because he was the chief speaker.

contents.verseText: The priest of Zeus, whose temple was just outside the city, brought bulls and wreaths to the city gates, hoping to offer a sacrifice along with the crowds.
contents: The priest of Zeus, whose temple was just outside the city, brought bulls and wreaths to the city gates, hoping to offer a sacrifice along with the crowds.

contents.verseText: But when the apostles Barnabas and Paul found out about this, they tore their clothes and rushed into the crowd, shouting,
contents: But when the apostles Barnabas and Paul found out about this, they tore their clothes and rushed into the crowd, shouting,

contents.verseText: “Men, why are you doing this? We too are only men, human like you. We are bringing you good news that you should turn from these worthless things to the living God, who made heaven and earth and sea and everything in them.
contents: “Men, why are you doing this? We too are only men, human like you. We are bringing you good news that you should turn from these worthless things to the living God, who made heaven and earth and sea and everything in them.

contents.verseText: In past generations, He let all nations go their own way.
contents: In past generations, He let all nations go their own way.

contents.verseText: Yet He has not left Himself without testimony to His goodness: He gives you rain from heaven and fruitful seasons, filling your hearts with food and gladness.”
contents: Yet He has not left Himself without testimony to His goodness: He gives you rain from heaven and fruitful seasons, filling your hearts with food and gladness.”

contents.verseText: Even with these words, Paul and Barnabas could hardly stop the crowds from sacrificing to them.
contents: Even with these words, Paul and Barnabas could hardly stop the crowds from sacrificing to them.

contents.verseText: Then some Jews arrived from Antioch and Iconium and won over the crowds. They stoned Paul and dragged him outside the city, presuming he was dead.
contents: Then some Jews arrived from Antioch and Iconium and won over the crowds. They stoned Paul and dragged him outside the city, presuming he was dead.

contents.verseText: But after the disciples had gathered around him, he got up and went back into the city. And the next day he left with Barnabas for Derbe.
contents: But after the disciples had gathered around him, he got up and went back into the city. And the next day he left with Barnabas for Derbe.

contents.verseText: They preached the gospel to that city and made many disciples. Then they returned to Lystra, Iconium, and Antioch,
contents: They preached the gospel to that city and made many disciples. Then they returned to Lystra, Iconium, and Antioch,

contents.verseText: strengthening the souls of the disciples and encouraging them to continue in the faith. “We must endure many hardships to enter the kingdom of God,” they said.
contents: strengthening the souls of the disciples and encouraging them to continue in the faith. “We must endure many hardships to enter the kingdom of God,” they said.

contents.verseText: Paul and Barnabas appointed elders for them in each church, praying and fasting as they entrusted them to the Lord, in whom they had believed.
contents: Paul and Barnabas appointed elders for them in each church, praying and fasting as they entrusted them to the Lord, in whom they had believed.

contents.verseText: After passing through Pisidia, they came to Pamphylia.
contents: After passing through Pisidia, they came to Pamphylia.

contents.verseText: And when they had spoken the word in Perga, they went down to Attalia.
contents: And when they had spoken the word in Perga, they went down to Attalia.

contents.verseText: From Attalia they sailed to Antioch, where they had been commended to the grace of God for the work they had just completed.
contents: From Attalia they sailed to Antioch, where they had been commended to the grace of God for the work they had just completed.

contents.verseText: When they arrived, they gathered the church together and reported all that God had done through them, and how He had opened the door of faith to the Gentiles.
contents: When they arrived, they gathered the church together and reported all that God had done through them, and how He had opened the door of faith to the Gentiles.

contents.verseText: And they spent a long time there with the disciples.
contents: And they spent a long time there with the disciples.

contents.verseText: Then some men came down from Judea and were teaching the brothers, “Unless you are circumcised according to the custom of Moses, you cannot be saved.”
contents: Then some men came down from Judea and were teaching the brothers, “Unless you are circumcised according to the custom of Moses, you cannot be saved.”

contents.verseText: And after engaging these men in sharp debate, Paul and Barnabas were appointed, along with some other believers, to go up to Jerusalem to see the apostles and elders about this question.
contents: And after engaging these men in sharp debate, Paul and Barnabas were appointed, along with some other believers, to go up to Jerusalem to see the apostles and elders about this question.

contents.verseText: Sent on their way by the church, they passed through Phoenicia and Samaria, recounting the conversion of the Gentiles and bringing great joy to all the brothers.
contents: Sent on their way by the church, they passed through Phoenicia and Samaria, recounting the conversion of the Gentiles and bringing great joy to all the brothers.

contents.verseText: On their arrival in Jerusalem, they were welcomed by the church and apostles and elders, to whom they reported all that God had done through them.
contents: On their arrival in Jerusalem, they were welcomed by the church and apostles and elders, to whom they reported all that God had done through them.

contents.verseText: But some believers from the party of the Pharisees stood up and declared, “The Gentiles must be circumcised and required to obey the law of Moses.”
contents: But some believers from the party of the Pharisees stood up and declared, “The Gentiles must be circumcised and required to obey the law of Moses.”

contents.verseText: So the apostles and elders met to look into this matter.
contents: So the apostles and elders met to look into this matter.

contents.verseText: After much discussion, Peter got up and said to them, “Brothers, you know that in the early days God made a choice among you that the Gentiles would hear from my lips the message of the gospel and believe.
contents: After much discussion, Peter got up and said to them, “Brothers, you know that in the early days God made a choice among you that the Gentiles would hear from my lips the message of the gospel and believe.

contents.verseText: And God, who knows the heart, showed His approval by giving the Holy Spirit to them, just as He did to us.
contents: And God, who knows the heart, showed His approval by giving the Holy Spirit to them, just as He did to us.

contents.verseText: He made no distinction between us and them, for He cleansed their hearts by faith.
contents: He made no distinction between us and them, for He cleansed their hearts by faith.

contents.verseText: Now then, why do you test God by placing on the necks of the disciples a yoke that neither we nor our fathers have been able to bear?
contents: Now then, why do you test God by placing on the necks of the disciples a yoke that neither we nor our fathers have been able to bear?

contents.verseText: On the contrary, we believe it is through the grace of the Lord Jesus that we are saved, just as they are.”
contents: On the contrary, we believe it is through the grace of the Lord Jesus that we are saved, just as they are.”

contents.verseText: The whole assembly fell silent as they listened to Barnabas and Paul describing the signs and wonders God had done among the Gentiles through them.
contents: The whole assembly fell silent as they listened to Barnabas and Paul describing the signs and wonders God had done among the Gentiles through them.

contents.verseText: When they had finished speaking, James declared, “Brothers, listen to me!
contents: When they had finished speaking, James declared, “Brothers, listen to me!

contents.verseText: Simon has told us how God first visited the Gentiles to take from them a people to be His own.
contents: Simon

footnote.ft: Greek Simeon, a variant of Simon

contents: has told us how God first visited the Gentiles to take from them a people to be His own.

contents.verseText: The words of the prophets agree with this, as it is written:
contents: The words of the prophets agree with this, as it is written:

contents.verseText: ‘After this I will return and rebuild the fallen tent of David. Its ruins I will rebuild, and I will restore it,
contents: ‘After this I will return and rebuild
the fallen tent of David.
Its ruins I will rebuild,
and I will restore it,

contents.verseText: so that the remnant of men may seek the Lord, and all the Gentiles who are called by My name, says the Lord who does these things
contents: so that the remnant of men may seek the Lord,
and all the Gentiles who are called by My name,
says the Lord who does these things

contents.verseText: that have been known for ages.’
contents: that have been known for ages.’

footnote.ft: Amos 9:11–12 (see also LXX); BYZ and TR says the Lord, who does all these things. 18 Known unto God are all His works from the ages.

contents.verseText: It is my judgment, therefore, that we should not cause trouble for the Gentiles who are turning to God.
contents: It is my judgment, therefore, that we should not cause trouble for the Gentiles who are turning to God.

contents.verseText: Instead, we should write and tell them to abstain from food polluted by idols, from sexual immorality, from the meat of strangled animals, and from blood.
contents: Instead, we should write and tell them to abstain from food polluted by idols, from sexual immorality, from the meat of strangled animals, and from blood.

contents.verseText: For Moses has been proclaimed in every city from ancient times and is read in the synagogues on every Sabbath.”
contents: For Moses has been proclaimed in every city from ancient times and is read in the synagogues on every Sabbath.”

s1: The Letter to the Gentile Believers

contents.verseText: Then the apostles and elders, with the whole church, decided to select men from among them to send to Antioch with Paul and Barnabas. They chose Judas called Barsabbas and Silas, two leaders among the brothers,
contents: Then the apostles and elders, with the whole church, decided to select men from among them to send to Antioch with Paul and Barnabas. They chose Judas called Barsabbas and Silas, two leaders among the brothers,

contents.verseText: and sent them with this letter: The apostles and the elders, your brothers, To the brothers among the Gentiles in Antioch, Syria, and Cilicia: Greetings.
contents: and sent them with this letter:
The apostles and the elders, your brothers,
To the brothers among the Gentiles in Antioch, Syria, and Cilicia:
Greetings.

contents.verseText: It has come to our attention that some went out from us without our authorization and unsettled you, troubling your minds by what they said.
contents: It has come to our attention that some went out from us without our authorization and unsettled you, troubling your minds by what they said.

footnote.ft: BYZ and TR by saying that you must be circumcised and keep the law.

contents.verseText: So we all agreed to choose men to send to you along with our beloved Barnabas and Paul,
contents: So we all agreed to choose men to send to you along with our beloved Barnabas and Paul,

contents.verseText: men who have risked their lives for the name of our Lord Jesus Christ.
contents: men who have risked their lives for the name of our Lord Jesus Christ.

contents.verseText: Therefore we are sending Judas and Silas to tell you in person the same things we are writing.
contents: Therefore we are sending Judas and Silas to tell you in person the same things we are writing.

contents.verseText: It seemed good to the Holy Spirit and to us not to burden you with anything beyond these essential requirements:
contents: It seemed good to the Holy Spirit and to us not to burden you with anything beyond these essential requirements:

contents.verseText: You must abstain from food sacrificed to idols, from blood, from the meat of strangled animals, and from sexual immorality. You will do well to avoid these things. Farewell.
contents: You must abstain from food sacrificed to idols, from blood, from the meat of strangled animals, and from sexual immorality. You will do well to avoid these things.
Farewell.

contents.verseText: So the men were sent off and went down to Antioch, where they assembled the congregation and delivered the letter.
contents: So the men were sent off and went down to Antioch, where they assembled the congregation and delivered the letter.

contents.verseText: When the people read it, they rejoiced at its encouraging message.
contents: When the people read it, they rejoiced at its encouraging message.

contents.verseText: Judas and Silas, who themselves were prophets, said much to encourage and strengthen the brothers.
contents: Judas and Silas, who themselves were prophets, said much to encourage and strengthen the brothers.

contents.verseText: After spending some time there, they were sent off by the brothers in peace to return to those who had sent them.
contents: After spending some time there, they were sent off by the brothers in peace to return to those who had sent them.

footnote.ft: TR includes 34 Silas, however, decided to remain there.

contents.verseText: But Paul and Barnabas remained at Antioch, along with many others, teaching and preaching the word of the Lord.
contents: But Paul and Barnabas remained at Antioch, along with many others, teaching and preaching the word of the Lord.

contents.verseText: Some time later Paul said to Barnabas, “Let us go back and visit the brothers in every town where we proclaimed the word of the Lord, to see how they are doing.”
contents: Some time later Paul said to Barnabas, “Let us go back and visit the brothers in every town where we proclaimed the word of the Lord, to see how they are doing.”

contents.verseText: Barnabas wanted to take John, also called Mark.
contents: Barnabas wanted to take John, also called Mark.

contents.verseText: But Paul thought it best not to take him, because he had deserted them in Pamphylia and had not accompanied them in the work.
contents: But Paul thought it best not to take him, because he had deserted them in Pamphylia and had not accompanied them in the work.

contents.verseText: Their disagreement was so sharp that they parted company. Barnabas took Mark and sailed for Cyprus,
contents: Their disagreement was so sharp that they parted company. Barnabas took Mark and sailed for Cyprus,

contents.verseText: but Paul chose Silas and left, commended by the brothers to the grace of the Lord.
contents: but Paul chose Silas and left, commended by the brothers to the grace of the Lord.

contents.verseText: And he traveled through Syria and Cilicia, strengthening the churches.
contents: And he traveled through Syria and Cilicia, strengthening the churches.

contents.verseText: Paul came to Derbe and then to Lystra, where he found a disciple named Timothy, the son of a believing Jewish woman and a Greek father.
contents: Paul came to Derbe and then to Lystra, where he found a disciple named Timothy, the son of a believing Jewish woman and a Greek father.

contents.verseText: The brothers in Lystra and Iconium spoke well of him.
contents: The brothers in Lystra and Iconium spoke well of him.

contents.verseText: Paul wanted Timothy to accompany him, so he took him and circumcised him on account of the Jews in that area, for they all knew that his father was a Greek.
contents: Paul wanted Timothy to accompany him, so he took him and circumcised him on account of the Jews in that area, for they all knew that his father was a Greek.

contents.verseText: As they went from town to town, they delivered the decisions handed down by the apostles and elders in Jerusalem for the people to obey.
contents: As they went from town to town, they delivered the decisions handed down by the apostles and elders in Jerusalem for the people to obey.

contents.verseText: So the churches were strengthened in the faith and grew daily in numbers.
contents: So the churches were strengthened in the faith and grew daily in numbers.

contents.verseText: After the Holy Spirit had prevented them from speaking the word in the province of Asia, they traveled through the region of Phrygia and Galatia.
contents: After the Holy Spirit had prevented them from speaking the word in the province of Asia,

footnote.ft: Literally in Asia; Asia was a Roman province in what is now western Turkey.

contents: they traveled through the region of Phrygia and Galatia.

contents.verseText: And when they came to the border of Mysia, they tried to enter Bithynia, but the Spirit of Jesus would not permit them.
contents: And when they came to the border of Mysia, they tried to enter Bithynia, but the Spirit of Jesus would not permit them.

contents.verseText: So they passed by Mysia and went down to Troas.
contents: So they passed by Mysia and went down to Troas.

contents.verseText: During the night, Paul had a vision of a man of Macedonia standing and pleading with him, “Come over to Macedonia and help us.”
contents: During the night, Paul had a vision of a man of Macedonia standing and pleading with him, “Come over to Macedonia and help us.”

contents.verseText: As soon as Paul had seen the vision, we got ready to leave for Macedonia, concluding that God had called us to preach the gospel to them.
contents: As soon as Paul had seen the vision, we got ready to leave for Macedonia, concluding that God had called us to preach the gospel to them.

contents.verseText: We sailed from Troas straight to Samothrace, and the following day on to Neapolis.
contents: We sailed from Troas straight to Samothrace, and the following day on to Neapolis.

contents.verseText: From there we went to the Roman colony of Philippi, the leading city of that district of Macedonia. And we stayed there several days.
contents: From there we went to the Roman colony of Philippi, the leading city of that district of Macedonia.

footnote.ft: Literally we went to Philippi, which is a leading city of the district of Macedonia—a colony

contents: And we stayed there several days.

contents.verseText: On the Sabbath we went outside the city gate along the river, where it was customary to find a place of prayer. After sitting down, we spoke to the women who had gathered there.
contents: On the Sabbath we went outside the city gate along the river, where it was customary to find a place of prayer. After sitting down, we spoke to the women who had gathered there.

contents.verseText: Among those listening was a woman named Lydia, a dealer in purple cloth from the city of Thyatira, who was a worshiper of God. The Lord opened her heart to respond to Paul’s message.
contents: Among those listening was a woman named Lydia, a dealer in purple cloth from the city of Thyatira, who was a worshiper of God. The Lord opened her heart to respond to Paul’s message.

contents.verseText: And when she and her household had been baptized, she urged us, “If you consider me a believer in the Lord, come and stay at my house.” And she persuaded us.
contents: And when she and her household had been baptized, she urged us, “If you consider me a believer in the Lord, come and stay at my house.” And she persuaded us.

contents.verseText: One day as we were going to the place of prayer, we were met by a slave girl with a spirit of divination, who earned a large income for her masters by fortune-telling.
contents: One day as we were going to the place of prayer, we were met by a slave girl with a spirit of divination,

footnote.ft: Greek a spirit of Python; that is, a spirit of divination named after the mythical serpent slain by Apollo

contents: who earned a large income for her masters by fortune-telling.

contents.verseText: This girl followed Paul and the rest of us, shouting, “These men are servants of the Most High God, who are proclaiming to you the way of salvation!”
contents: This girl followed Paul and the rest of us, shouting, “These men are servants of the Most High God, who are proclaiming to you the way of salvation!”

contents.verseText: She continued this for many days. Eventually Paul grew so aggravated that he turned and said to the spirit, “In the name of Jesus Christ I command you to come out of her!” And the spirit left her at that very moment.
contents: She continued this for many days. Eventually Paul grew so aggravated that he turned and said to the spirit, “In the name of Jesus Christ I command you to come out of her!” And the spirit left her at that very moment.

contents.verseText: When the girl’s owners saw that their hope of making money was gone, they seized Paul and Silas and dragged them before the authorities in the marketplace.
contents: When the girl’s owners saw that their hope of making money was gone, they seized Paul and Silas and dragged them before the authorities in the marketplace.

contents.verseText: They brought them to the magistrates and said, “These men are Jews and are throwing our city into turmoil
contents: They brought them to the magistrates and said, “These men are Jews and are throwing our city into turmoil

contents.verseText: by promoting customs that are unlawful for us Romans to adopt or practice.”
contents: by promoting customs that are unlawful for us Romans to adopt or practice.”

contents.verseText: The crowd joined in the attack against Paul and Silas, and the magistrates ordered that they be stripped and beaten with rods.
contents: The crowd joined in the attack against Paul and Silas, and the magistrates ordered that they be stripped and beaten with rods.

contents.verseText: And after striking them with many blows, they threw them into prison and ordered the jailer to guard them securely.
contents: And after striking them with many blows, they threw them into prison and ordered the jailer to guard them securely.

contents.verseText: On receiving this order, he placed them in the inner cell and fastened their feet in the stocks.
contents: On receiving this order, he placed them in the inner cell and fastened their feet in the stocks.

contents.verseText: About midnight Paul and Silas were praying and singing hymns to God, and the other prisoners were listening to them.
contents: About midnight Paul and Silas were praying and singing hymns to God, and the other prisoners were listening to them.

contents.verseText: Suddenly a strong earthquake shook the foundations of the prison. At once all the doors flew open and everyone’s chains came loose.
contents: Suddenly a strong earthquake shook the foundations of the prison. At once all the doors flew open and everyone’s chains came loose.

contents.verseText: When the jailer woke up and saw the prison doors open, he drew his sword and was about to kill himself, presuming that the prisoners had escaped.
contents: When the jailer woke up and saw the prison doors open, he drew his sword and was about to kill himself, presuming that the prisoners had escaped.

contents.verseText: But Paul called out in a loud voice, “Do not harm yourself! We are all here!”
contents: But Paul called out in a loud voice, “Do not harm yourself! We are all here!”

contents.verseText: Calling for lights, the jailer rushed in and fell trembling before Paul and Silas.
contents: Calling for lights, the jailer rushed in and fell trembling before Paul and Silas.

contents.verseText: Then he brought them out and asked, “Sirs, what must I do to be saved?”
contents: Then he brought them out and asked, “Sirs, what must I do to be saved?”

contents.verseText: They replied, “Believe in the Lord Jesus and you will be saved, you and your household.”
contents: They replied, “Believe in the Lord Jesus and you will be saved, you and your household.”

contents.verseText: Then Paul and Silas spoke the word of the Lord to him and to everyone in his house.
contents: Then Paul and Silas spoke the word of the Lord to him and to everyone in his house.

contents.verseText: At that hour of the night, the jailer took them and washed their wounds. And without delay, he and all his household were baptized.
contents: At that hour of the night, the jailer took them and washed their wounds. And without delay, he and all his household were baptized.

contents.verseText: Then he brought them into his home and set a meal before them. So he and all his household rejoiced that they had come to believe in God.
contents: Then he brought them into his home and set a meal before them. So he and all his household rejoiced that they had come to believe in God.

contents.verseText: When daylight came, the magistrates sent their officers with the order: “Release those men.”
contents: When daylight came, the magistrates sent their officers with the order: “Release those men.”

contents.verseText: The jailer informed Paul: “The magistrates have sent orders to release you. Now you may go on your way in peace.”
contents: The jailer informed Paul: “The magistrates have sent orders to release you. Now you may go on your way in peace.”

contents.verseText: But Paul said to the officers, “They beat us publicly without a trial and threw us into prison, even though we are Roman citizens. And now do they want to send us away secretly? Absolutely not! Let them come themselves and escort us out!”
contents: But Paul said to the officers, “They beat us publicly without a trial and threw us into prison, even though we are Roman citizens. And now do they want to send us away secretly? Absolutely not! Let them come themselves and escort us out!”

contents.verseText: So the officers relayed this message to the magistrates, who were alarmed to hear that Paul and Silas were Roman citizens.
contents: So the officers relayed this message to the magistrates, who were alarmed to hear that Paul and Silas were Roman citizens.

contents.verseText: They came to appease them and led them out, requesting that they leave the city.
contents: They came to appease them and led them out, requesting that they leave the city.

contents.verseText: After Paul and Silas came out of the prison, they went to Lydia’s house to see the brothers and encourage them. Then they left the city.
contents: After Paul and Silas came out of the prison, they went to Lydia’s house to see the brothers and encourage them. Then they left the city.

contents.verseText: When they had passed through Amphipolis and Apollonia, they came to Thessalonica, where there was a Jewish synagogue.
contents: When they had passed through Amphipolis and Apollonia, they came to Thessalonica, where there was a Jewish synagogue.

contents.verseText: As was his custom, Paul went into the synagogue, and on three Sabbaths he reasoned with them from the Scriptures,
contents: As was his custom, Paul went into the synagogue, and on three Sabbaths he reasoned with them from the Scriptures,

contents.verseText: explaining and proving that the Christ had to suffer and rise from the dead. “This Jesus I am proclaiming to you is the Christ,” he declared.
contents: explaining and proving that the Christ had to suffer and rise from the dead. “This Jesus I am proclaiming to you is the Christ,” he declared.

contents.verseText: Some of the Jews were persuaded and joined Paul and Silas, along with a large number of God-fearing Greeks and quite a few leading women.
contents: Some of the Jews were persuaded and joined Paul and Silas, along with a large number of God-fearing Greeks and quite a few leading women.

contents.verseText: The Jews, however, became jealous. So they brought in some troublemakers from the marketplace, formed a mob, and sent the city into an uproar. They raided Jason’s house in search of Paul and Silas, hoping to bring them out to the people.
contents: The Jews, however, became jealous. So they brought in some troublemakers from the marketplace, formed a mob, and sent the city into an uproar. They raided Jason’s house in search of Paul and Silas, hoping to bring them out to the people.

contents.verseText: But when they could not find them, they dragged Jason and some other brothers before the city officials, shouting, “These men who have turned the world upside down have now come here,
contents: But when they could not find them, they dragged Jason and some other brothers before the city officials, shouting, “These men who have turned the world upside down have now come here,

contents.verseText: and Jason has welcomed them into his home. They are all defying Caesar’s decrees, saying that there is another king, named Jesus!”
contents: and Jason has welcomed them into his home. They are all defying Caesar’s decrees, saying that there is another king, named Jesus!”

contents.verseText: On hearing this, the crowd and city officials were greatly disturbed.
contents: On hearing this, the crowd and city officials were greatly disturbed.

contents.verseText: And they collected bond from Jason and the others, and then released them.
contents: And they collected bond from Jason and the others, and then released them.

contents.verseText: As soon as night had fallen, the brothers sent Paul and Silas away to Berea. On arriving there, they went into the Jewish synagogue.
contents: As soon as night had fallen, the brothers sent Paul and Silas away to Berea. On arriving there, they went into the Jewish synagogue.

contents.verseText: Now the Bereans were more noble-minded than the Thessalonians, for they received the message with great eagerness and examined the Scriptures every day to see if these teachings were true.
contents: Now the Bereans were more noble-minded than the Thessalonians, for they received the message with great eagerness and examined the Scriptures every day to see if these teachings were true.

footnote.ft: Literally with great eagerness, every day examining the Writings, whether these things were so.

contents.verseText: As a result, many of them believed, along with quite a few prominent Greek women and men.
contents: As a result, many of them believed, along with quite a few prominent Greek women and men.

contents.verseText: But when the Jews from Thessalonica learned that Paul was also proclaiming the word of God in Berea, they went there themselves to incite and agitate the crowds.
contents: But when the Jews from Thessalonica learned that Paul was also proclaiming the word of God in Berea, they went there themselves to incite and agitate the crowds.

contents.verseText: The brothers immediately sent Paul to the coast, but Silas and Timothy remained in Berea.
contents: The brothers immediately sent Paul to the coast, but Silas and Timothy remained in Berea.

contents.verseText: Those who escorted Paul brought him to Athens and then returned with instructions for Silas and Timothy to join him as soon as possible.
contents: Those who escorted Paul brought him to Athens and then returned with instructions for Silas and Timothy to join him as soon as possible.

contents.verseText: While Paul was waiting for them in Athens, he was deeply disturbed in his spirit to see that the city was full of idols.
contents: While Paul was waiting for them in Athens, he was deeply disturbed in his spirit to see that the city was full of idols.

contents.verseText: So he reasoned in the synagogue with the Jews and God-fearing Gentiles, and in the marketplace with those he met each day.
contents: So he reasoned in the synagogue with the Jews and God-fearing Gentiles, and in the marketplace with those he met each day.

contents.verseText: Some Epicurean and Stoic philosophers also began to debate with him. Some of them asked, “What is this babbler trying to say?” Others said, “He seems to be advocating foreign gods.” They said this because Paul was proclaiming the good news of Jesus and the resurrection.
contents: Some Epicurean and Stoic philosophers also began to debate with him. Some of them asked, “What is this babbler trying to say?” Others said, “He seems to be advocating foreign gods.” They said this because Paul was proclaiming the good news of Jesus and the resurrection.

contents.verseText: So they took Paul and brought him to the Areopagus, where they asked him, “May we know what this new teaching is that you are presenting?
contents: So they took Paul and brought him to the Areopagus,

footnote.ft: Or Ares Hill or Mars Hill; also in verse 22 and added for clarity in verse 33

contents: where they asked him, “May we know what this new teaching is that you are presenting?

contents.verseText: For you are bringing some strange notions to our ears, and we want to know what they mean.”
contents: For you are bringing some strange notions to our ears, and we want to know what they mean.”

contents.verseText: Now all the Athenians and foreigners who lived there spent their time doing nothing more than hearing and articulating new ideas.
contents: Now all the Athenians and foreigners who lived there spent their time doing nothing more than hearing and articulating new ideas.

contents.verseText: Then Paul stood up in the meeting of the Areopagus and said, “Men of Athens, I see that in every way you are very religious.
contents: Then Paul stood up in the meeting

footnote.ft: Literally in the middle

contents: of the Areopagus and said, “Men of Athens, I see that in every way you are very religious.

contents.verseText: For as I walked around and examined your objects of worship, I even found an altar with this inscription: TO AN UNKNOWN GOD. Therefore what you worship as something unknown, I now proclaim to you.
contents: For as I walked around and examined your objects of worship, I even found an altar with this inscription:
TO AN UNKNOWN GOD.
Therefore what you worship as something unknown, I now proclaim to you.

contents.verseText: The God who made the world and everything in it is the Lord of heaven and earth and does not live in temples made by human hands.
contents: The God who made the world and everything in it is the Lord of heaven and earth and does not live in temples made by human hands.

contents.verseText: Nor is He served by human hands, as if He needed anything, because He Himself gives everyone life and breath and everything else.
contents: Nor is He served by human hands, as if He needed anything, because He Himself gives everyone life and breath and everything else.

contents.verseText: From one man He made every nation of men, that they should inhabit the whole earth; and He determined their appointed times and the boundaries of their lands.
contents: From one man

footnote.ft: Literally From one; BYZ and TR From one blood

contents: He made every nation of men, that they should inhabit the whole earth; and He determined their appointed times and the boundaries of their lands.

contents.verseText: God intended that they would seek Him and perhaps reach out for Him and find Him, though He is not far from each one of us.
contents: God intended that they would seek Him and perhaps reach out for Him and find Him, though He is not far from each one of us.

contents.verseText: ‘For in Him we live and move and have our being.’ As some of your own poets have said, ‘We are His offspring.’
contents: ‘For in Him we live and move and have our being.’

footnote.ft: This is probably a quote from the Cretan philosopher Epimenides of Knossos.

contents: As some of your own poets have said, ‘We are His offspring.’

footnote.ft: This is probably a quote from the poem “Phainomena” by the Cilician philosopher Aratus.

contents.verseText: Therefore, being offspring of God, we should not think that the Divine Being is like gold or silver or stone, an image formed by man’s skill and imagination.
contents: Therefore, being offspring of God, we should not think that the Divine Being is like gold or silver or stone, an image formed by man’s skill and imagination.

contents.verseText: Although God overlooked the ignorance of earlier times, He now commands all people everywhere to repent.
contents: Although God overlooked the ignorance of earlier times, He now commands all people everywhere to repent.

contents.verseText: For He has set a day when He will judge the world with justice by the Man He has appointed. He has given proof of this to everyone by raising Him from the dead.”
contents: For He has set a day when He will judge the world with justice by the Man He has appointed. He has given proof of this to everyone by raising Him from the dead.”

contents.verseText: When they heard about the resurrection of the dead, some began to mock him, but others said, “We want to hear you again on this topic.”
contents: When they heard about the resurrection of the dead, some began to mock him, but others said, “We want to hear you again on this topic.”

contents.verseText: At that, Paul left the Areopagus.
contents: At that, Paul left the Areopagus.

contents.verseText: But some joined him and believed, including Dionysius the Areopagite, a woman named Damaris, and others who were with them.
contents: But some

footnote.ft: Literally some men

contents: joined him and believed, including Dionysius the Areopagite, a woman named Damaris, and others who were with them.

contents.verseText: After this, Paul left Athens and went to Corinth.
contents: After this, Paul left Athens and went to Corinth.

contents.verseText: There he found a Jew named Aquila, a native of Pontus, who had recently come from Italy with his wife Priscilla because Claudius had ordered all the Jews to leave Rome. Paul went to visit them,
contents: There he found a Jew named Aquila, a native of Pontus, who had recently come from Italy with his wife Priscilla because Claudius had ordered all the Jews to leave Rome. Paul went to visit them,

contents.verseText: and he stayed and worked with them because they were tentmakers by trade, just as he was.
contents: and he stayed and worked with them because they were tentmakers by trade, just as he was.

contents.verseText: Every Sabbath he reasoned in the synagogue, trying to persuade Jews and Greeks alike.
contents: Every Sabbath he reasoned in the synagogue, trying to persuade Jews and Greeks alike.

contents.verseText: And when Silas and Timothy came down from Macedonia, Paul devoted himself fully to the word, testifying to the Jews that Jesus is the Christ.
contents: And when Silas and Timothy came down from Macedonia, Paul devoted himself fully to the word, testifying to the Jews that Jesus is the Christ.

contents.verseText: But when they opposed and insulted him, he shook out his garments and told them, “Your blood be on your own heads! I am innocent of it. From now on I will go to the Gentiles.”
contents: But when they opposed and insulted him, he shook out his garments and told them, “Your blood be on your own heads! I am innocent of it. From now on I will go to the Gentiles.”

contents.verseText: So Paul left the synagogue and went next door to the house of Titus Justus, a worshiper of God.
contents: So Paul left the synagogue and went next door to the house of Titus Justus,

footnote.ft: ECM; NA, SBL, NE, and WH Titius Justus; BYZ and TR Justus

contents: a worshiper of God.

contents.verseText: Crispus, the synagogue leader, and his whole household believed in the Lord. And many of the Corinthians who heard the message believed and were baptized.
contents: Crispus, the synagogue leader, and his whole household believed in the Lord. And many of the Corinthians who heard the message believed and were baptized.

contents.verseText: One night the Lord spoke to Paul in a vision: “Do not be afraid; keep on speaking; do not be silent.
contents: One night the Lord spoke to Paul in a vision: “Do not be afraid; keep on speaking; do not be silent.

contents.verseText: For I am with you and no one will lay a hand on you, because I have many people in this city.”
contents: For I am with you and no one will lay a hand on you, because I have many people in this city.”

contents.verseText: So Paul stayed for a year and a half, teaching the word of God among the Corinthians.
contents: So Paul stayed for a year and a half, teaching the word of God among the Corinthians.

contents.verseText: While Gallio was proconsul of Achaia, the Jews coordinated an attack on Paul and brought him before the judgment seat.
contents: While Gallio was proconsul of Achaia, the Jews coordinated an attack on Paul and brought him before the judgment seat.

contents.verseText: “This man is persuading the people to worship God in ways contrary to the law,” they said.
contents: “This man is persuading the people to worship God in ways contrary to the law,” they said.

contents.verseText: But just as Paul was about to speak, Gallio told the Jews, “If this matter involved a wrongdoing or vicious crime, O Jews, it would be reasonable for me to hear your complaint.
contents: But just as Paul was about to speak, Gallio told the Jews, “If this matter involved a wrongdoing or vicious crime, O Jews, it would be reasonable for me to hear your complaint.

contents.verseText: But since it is a dispute about words and names and your own law, settle it yourselves. I refuse to be a judge of such things.”
contents: But since it is a dispute about words and names and your own law, settle it yourselves. I refuse to be a judge of such things.”

contents.verseText: And he drove them away from the judgment seat.
contents: And he drove them away from the judgment seat.

contents.verseText: At this, the crowd seized Sosthenes the synagogue leader and beat him in front of the judgment seat. But none of this was of concern to Gallio.
contents: At this, the crowd

footnote.ft: Literally they all; BYZ and TR all the Greeks

contents: seized Sosthenes the synagogue leader and beat him in front of the judgment seat. But none of this was of concern to Gallio.

contents.verseText: Paul remained in Corinth for quite some time before saying goodbye to the brothers. He had his head shaved in Cenchrea to keep a vow he had made, and then he sailed for Syria, accompanied by Priscilla and Aquila.
contents: Paul remained in Corinth for quite some time before saying goodbye to the brothers. He had his head shaved in Cenchrea to keep a vow he had made, and then he sailed for Syria, accompanied by Priscilla and Aquila.

contents.verseText: When they reached Ephesus, Paul parted ways with Priscilla and Aquila. He himself went into the synagogue there and reasoned with the Jews.
contents: When they reached Ephesus, Paul parted ways with Priscilla and Aquila. He himself went into the synagogue there and reasoned with the Jews.

contents.verseText: When they asked him to stay for a while longer, he declined.
contents: When they asked him to stay for a while longer, he declined.

contents.verseText: But as he left, he said, “I will come back to you if God is willing.” And he set sail from Ephesus.
contents: But as he left, he said, “I will come back

footnote.ft: BYZ and TR I must by all means keep this feast that comes in Jerusalem, but I will come back

contents: to you if God is willing.” And he set sail from Ephesus.

contents.verseText: When Paul had landed at Caesarea, he went up and greeted the church at Jerusalem. Then he went down to Antioch.
contents: When Paul had landed at Caesarea, he went up and greeted the church at Jerusalem.

footnote.ft: Literally he went up and greeted the church

contents: Then he went down to Antioch.

contents.verseText: After Paul had spent some time in Antioch, he traveled from place to place throughout the region of Galatia and Phrygia, strengthening all the disciples.
contents: After Paul had spent some time in Antioch, he traveled from place to place throughout the region of Galatia and Phrygia, strengthening all the disciples.

contents.verseText: Meanwhile a Jew named Apollos, a native of Alexandria, came to Ephesus. He was an eloquent man, well versed in the Scriptures.
contents: Meanwhile a Jew named Apollos, a native of Alexandria, came to Ephesus. He was an eloquent man, well versed in the Scriptures.

contents.verseText: He had been instructed in the way of the Lord and was fervent in spirit. He spoke and taught accurately about Jesus, though he knew only the baptism of John.
contents: He had been instructed in the way of the Lord and was fervent in spirit. He spoke and taught accurately about Jesus,

footnote.ft: BYZ and TR about the Lord

contents: though he knew only the baptism of John.

contents.verseText: And he began to speak boldly in the synagogue. When Priscilla and Aquila heard him, they took him in and explained to him the way of God more accurately.
contents: And he began to speak boldly in the synagogue. When Priscilla and Aquila heard him, they took him in and explained to him the way of God more accurately.

contents.verseText: When Apollos resolved to cross over to Achaia, the brothers encouraged him and wrote to the disciples there to welcome him. On his arrival, he was a great help to those who by grace had believed.
contents: When Apollos resolved to cross over to Achaia, the brothers encouraged him and wrote to the disciples there to welcome him. On his arrival, he was a great help to those who by grace had believed.

contents.verseText: For he powerfully refuted the Jews in public debate, proving from the Scriptures that Jesus is the Christ.
contents: For he powerfully refuted the Jews in public debate, proving from the Scriptures that Jesus is the Christ.

s1: The Holy Spirit Received at Ephesus

contents.verseText: While Apollos was at Corinth, Paul passed through the interior and came to Ephesus. There he found some disciples
contents: While Apollos was at Corinth, Paul passed through the interior

footnote.ft: Or the highland

contents: and came to Ephesus. There he found some disciples

contents.verseText: and asked them, “Did you receive the Holy Spirit when you became believers?” “No,” they answered, “we have not even heard that there is a Holy Spirit.”
contents: and asked them, “Did you receive the Holy Spirit when you became believers?”
“No,” they answered, “we have not even heard that there is a Holy Spirit.”

contents.verseText: “Into what, then, were you baptized?” Paul asked. “The baptism of John,” they replied.
contents: “Into what, then, were you baptized?” Paul asked.
“The baptism of John,” they replied.

contents.verseText: Paul explained: “John’s baptism was a baptism of repentance. He told the people to believe in the One coming after him, that is, in Jesus.”
contents: Paul explained: “John’s baptism was a baptism of repentance. He told the people to believe in the One coming after him, that is, in Jesus.”

contents.verseText: On hearing this, they were baptized into the name of the Lord Jesus.
contents: On hearing this, they were baptized into the name of the Lord Jesus.

contents.verseText: And when Paul laid his hands on them, the Holy Spirit came upon them, and they spoke in tongues and prophesied.
contents: And when Paul laid his hands on them, the Holy Spirit came upon them, and they spoke in tongues and prophesied.

contents.verseText: There were about twelve men in all.
contents: There were about twelve men in all.

contents.verseText: Then Paul went into the synagogue and spoke boldly there for three months, arguing persuasively about the kingdom of God.
contents: Then Paul went into the synagogue and spoke boldly there for three months, arguing persuasively about the kingdom of God.

contents.verseText: But when some of them stubbornly refused to believe and publicly maligned the Way, Paul took his disciples and left the synagogue to conduct daily discussions in the lecture hall of Tyrannus.
contents: But when some of them stubbornly refused to believe and publicly maligned the Way, Paul took his disciples and left the synagogue to conduct daily discussions in the lecture hall of Tyrannus.

contents.verseText: This continued for two years, so that everyone who lived in the province of Asia, Jews and Greeks alike, heard the word of the Lord.
contents: This continued for two years, so that everyone who lived in the province of Asia,

footnote.ft: Literally in Asia; Asia was a Roman province in what is now western Turkey; similarly in verses 22, 26, 27, and 31.

contents: Jews and Greeks alike, heard the word of the Lord.

contents.verseText: God did extraordinary miracles through the hands of Paul,
contents: God did extraordinary miracles through the hands of Paul,

contents.verseText: so that even handkerchiefs and aprons that had touched him were taken to the sick, and the diseases and evil spirits left them.
contents: so that even handkerchiefs

footnote.ft: Greek soudaria

contents: and aprons that had touched him were taken to the sick, and the diseases and evil spirits left them.

contents.verseText: Now there were some itinerant Jewish exorcists who tried to invoke the name of the Lord Jesus over those with evil spirits. They would say, “I bind you by Jesus, whom Paul proclaims.”
contents: Now there were some itinerant Jewish exorcists who tried to invoke the name of the Lord Jesus over those with evil spirits. They would say, “I bind you by Jesus, whom Paul proclaims.”

contents.verseText: Seven sons of Sceva, a Jewish chief priest, were doing this.
contents: Seven sons of Sceva, a Jewish chief priest, were doing this.

contents.verseText: Eventually, one of the evil spirits answered them, “Jesus I know, and I know about Paul, but who are you?”
contents: Eventually, one of the evil spirits answered them, “Jesus I know, and I know about Paul, but who are you?”

contents.verseText: Then the man with the evil spirit jumped on them and overpowered them all. The attack was so violent that they ran out of the house naked and wounded.
contents: Then the man with the evil spirit jumped on them and overpowered them all. The attack was so violent that they ran out of the house naked and wounded.

contents.verseText: This became known to all the Jews and Greeks living in Ephesus, and fear came over all of them. So the name of the Lord Jesus was held in high honor.
contents: This became known to all the Jews and Greeks living in Ephesus, and fear came over all of them. So the name of the Lord Jesus was held in high honor.

contents.verseText: Many who had believed now came forward, confessing and disclosing their deeds.
contents: Many who had believed now came forward, confessing and disclosing their deeds.

contents.verseText: And a number of those who had practiced magic arts brought their books and burned them in front of everyone. When the value of the books was calculated, the total came to fifty thousand drachmas.
contents: And a number of those who had practiced magic arts brought their books and burned them in front of everyone. When the value of the books was calculated, the total came to fifty thousand drachmas.

footnote.ft: Or fifty thousand pieces of silver. A drachma was a silver coin worth about one day’s wages.

contents.verseText: So the word of the Lord powerfully continued to spread and prevail.
contents: So the word of the Lord powerfully continued to spread and prevail.

contents.verseText: After these things had happened, Paul resolved in the Spirit to go to Jerusalem after he had passed through Macedonia and Achaia. “After I have been there,” he said, “I must see Rome as well.”
contents: After these things had happened, Paul resolved in the Spirit

footnote.ft: Or resolved in spirit

contents: to go to Jerusalem after he had passed through Macedonia and Achaia. “After I have been there,” he said, “I must see Rome as well.”

contents.verseText: He sent two of his helpers, Timothy and Erastus, to Macedonia, while he stayed for a time in the province of Asia.
contents: He sent two of his helpers, Timothy and Erastus, to Macedonia, while he stayed for a time in the province of Asia.

contents.verseText: About that time there arose a great disturbance about the Way.
contents: About that time there arose a great disturbance

footnote.ft: Literally there arose no little disturbance

contents: about the Way.

contents.verseText: It began with a silversmith named Demetrius who made silver shrines of Artemis, bringing much business to the craftsmen.
contents: It began with a silversmith named Demetrius who made silver shrines of Artemis, bringing much business

footnote.ft: Literally bringing no little business

contents: to the craftsmen.

contents.verseText: Demetrius assembled the craftsmen, along with the workmen in related trades. “Men,” he said, “you know that this business is our source of prosperity.
contents: Demetrius assembled the craftsmen, along with the workmen in related trades. “Men,” he said, “you know that this business is our source of prosperity.

contents.verseText: And you can see and hear that not only in Ephesus, but in nearly the whole province of Asia, Paul has persuaded a great number of people to turn away. He says that man-made gods are no gods at all.
contents: And you can see and hear that not only in Ephesus, but in nearly the whole province of Asia, Paul has persuaded a great number of people to turn away. He says that man-made gods are no gods at all.

contents.verseText: There is danger not only that our business will fall into disrepute, but also that the temple of the great goddess Artemis will be discredited and her majesty deposed—she who is worshiped by all the province of Asia and the whole world.”
contents: There is danger not only that our business will fall into disrepute, but also that the temple of the great goddess Artemis will be discredited and her majesty deposed—she who is worshiped by all the province of Asia and the whole world.”

contents.verseText: When the men heard this, they were enraged and began shouting, “Great is Artemis of the Ephesians!”
contents: When the men heard this, they were enraged and began shouting, “Great is Artemis of the Ephesians!”

contents.verseText: Soon the whole city was in disarray. They rushed together into the theatre, dragging with them Gaius and Aristarchus, Paul’s traveling companions from Macedonia.
contents: Soon the whole city was in disarray. They rushed together into the theatre, dragging with them Gaius and Aristarchus, Paul’s traveling companions from Macedonia.

contents.verseText: Paul wanted to go before the assembly, but the disciples would not allow him.
contents: Paul wanted to go before the assembly, but the disciples would not allow him.

contents.verseText: Even some of Paul’s friends who were officials of the province of Asia sent word to him, begging him not to venture into the theatre.
contents: Even some of Paul’s friends who were officials of the province of Asia

footnote.ft: Or friends who were Asiarchs

contents: sent word to him, begging him not to venture into the theatre.

contents.verseText: Meanwhile the assembly was in turmoil. Some were shouting one thing and some another, and most of them did not even know why they were there.
contents: Meanwhile the assembly was in turmoil. Some were shouting one thing and some another, and most of them did not even know why they were there.

contents.verseText: The Jews in the crowd pushed Alexander forward to explain himself, and he motioned for silence so he could make his defense to the people.
contents: The Jews in the crowd pushed Alexander forward to explain himself, and he motioned for silence so he could make his defense to the people.

contents.verseText: But when they realized that he was a Jew, they all shouted in unison for about two hours: “Great is Artemis of the Ephesians!”
contents: But when they realized that he was a Jew, they all shouted in unison for about two hours: “Great is Artemis of the Ephesians!”

contents.verseText: Finally the city clerk quieted the crowd and declared, “Men of Ephesus, doesn’t everyone know that the city of Ephesus is guardian of the temple of the great Artemis and of her image, which fell from heaven?
contents: Finally the city clerk quieted the crowd and declared, “Men of Ephesus, doesn’t everyone know that the city of Ephesus is guardian of the temple of the great Artemis and of her image, which fell from heaven?

contents.verseText: Since these things are undeniable, you ought to be calm and not do anything rash.
contents: Since these things are undeniable, you ought to be calm and not do anything rash.

contents.verseText: For you have brought these men here, though they have neither robbed our temple nor blasphemed our goddess.
contents: For you have brought these men here, though they have neither robbed our temple nor blasphemed our goddess.

contents.verseText: So if Demetrius and his fellow craftsmen have a complaint against anyone, the courts are open and proconsuls are available. Let them bring charges against one another there.
contents: So if Demetrius and his fellow craftsmen have a complaint against anyone, the courts are open and proconsuls are available. Let them bring charges against one another there.

contents.verseText: But if you are seeking anything beyond this, it must be settled in a legal assembly.
contents: But if you are seeking anything beyond this, it must be settled in a legal assembly.

contents.verseText: For we are in jeopardy of being charged with rioting for today’s events, and we have no justification to account for this commotion.”
contents: For we are in jeopardy of being charged with rioting for today’s events, and we have no justification to account for this commotion.”

contents.verseText: After he had said this, he dismissed the assembly.
contents: After he had said this, he dismissed the assembly.

contents.verseText: When the uproar had ended, Paul sent for the disciples. And after encouraging them, he said goodbye to them and left for Macedonia.
contents: When the uproar had ended, Paul sent for the disciples. And after encouraging them, he said goodbye to them and left for Macedonia.

contents.verseText: After traveling through that area and speaking many words of encouragement, he arrived in Greece,
contents: After traveling through that area and speaking many words of encouragement, he arrived in Greece,

contents.verseText: where he stayed three months. And when the Jews formed a plot against him as he was about to sail for Syria, he decided to go back through Macedonia.
contents: where he stayed three months. And when the Jews formed a plot against him as he was about to sail for Syria, he decided to go back through Macedonia.

contents.verseText: Paul was accompanied by Sopater son of Pyrrhus from Berea, Aristarchus and Secundus from Thessalonica, Gaius from Derbe, Timothy, and Tychicus and Trophimus from the province of Asia.

contents: The next day Paul went in with us to see James, and all the elders were present.
